Reviews.Title: “Switched to other hotel with unreasonable reason”
Reviews.Author: HKTraveler123
Reviews.Content: We have booked the Hotel Opera Roma for 2 nights stay on 28 & 29 Mar. When we checked in, the hotel staff told us that we were needed to switch to Hotel Sonya, their sister hotel, since their computer system and air-condition was out of order. We have no way but to accept their offer since we have paid the room price to the booking online. When we claimed for the price difference from the hotel, the staff said that they've upgraded us to the superior room in which was not. We also discovered that we were being cheated since the staff in Hotel Sonya told us that they quite often exchange guest in between them.

Reviews.Title: “Upgraded to Suite”
Reviews.Author: turistik
Reviews.Content: Booked two nights at the main property Hotel Sonya but arrived to early in the morning to check in. So we left our luggage and headed out to explore Rome. When we returned hours later exhausted we found we had been upgraded to a suite up the block in the Hotel Opera. With an abundance of room, comfortable king size bed, jetted shower and a whirlpool tub we enjoyed our days and nights in luxury. The staff was outstanding, reliable and accommodating. Each morning we enjoyed the typical Italian breakfast and coffee. We would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a great location and awesome quality.

Reviews.Title: “Did I stay at a different hotel?”
Reviews.Author: happyjackman
Reviews.Content: I use TripAdvisor to choose all my hotels and this is the first time I have ever completely disagreed with the majority of reviews. This place was so bad that my husband and I switched to a different hotel within an hour of check in! First, the entrance is hard to find. We hauled our luggage around Rome for much longer than we needed to because the hotel is a little buried. It is in a good part of town (close to the train station and Via Nazionale), but on a small side street with little signage. I was immediately concerned when there were bars over the doors and we had to be buzzed in. The lobby was small but the gentleman at check in was very friendly. However, our room was the major problem. I think we got room 102 that people have warned about in other reviews. I'm convinced it's a converted closet. We saw one room with a room number and then a tiny door next to it with no room number, just labeled "private". That was our room! It was so small that we could not lay our suitcases down to open them. Literally. And to walk to the bathroom, I had to walk OVER the bed because I couldn't squeeze by the space between the end of the bed and the "closet". I'm 4'11" and weigh 115 pounds. If I can't squeeze by, that's saying a lot! We tried to be optimistic and my husband opted to take a shower to start fresh. About 60 seconds into his shower, the bathroom almost flooded because the shower drain was so backed up. He had to turn off the shower every minute for a minute to let it drain before repeating the cycle. We had had enough and immediately went to another hotel around the corner on Nazionale to book a new room. (Sidenote: We had a great stay there - see my other reviews!) We then notified the front desk we'd be departing and, to their credit, the man was very sorry and repeatedly tried to upgrade us to stay. BUT why would you put someone in a bad room in the first place? Bad business and we will not be back!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, friendly little Italian hotel”
Reviews.Author: DenmBelfast
Reviews.Content: This was not a hotel like you would find at home. It is a small reception area with a small breakfast room just off it, in a building that has ordinary apartments in it. The Hotel owns two floors, in saying that the rooms are lovely, they are clean and well furnished with a mini bar that is very reasonably priced. Were this hotel scores high in my opinion is the very friendly and obliging staff, Lito in the reception was great he gave us a map with all the sights marked of with the easiest routes to and from the hotel with bus numbers to always get us back to the hotel. He ordered taxis when we needed them and stored our bags on the last day. The girl in the breakfast room was great she made the most wonderful coffees and teas any way you liked them with seconds and thirds even, on the last day when my daughter came down late just before our taxi arrived she rushed to get her coffee and a croissant and insisted she ate it so she would not be going out on an empty stomach, they were all so thoughtful. As long as you know it is not going to be a Jurys, but a lovely little Italian hotel then you won't be disapointed with the location or the staff or the good clean rooms. All the sights are about a 10-15 minute walk, the only time we used transport was to go to the Vatican and the pantheon everything else was an easy walk, just to let my fellow Irish travellers know the food in the Irish pub around the corner is not what you would want, stick to the little Italian street cafes or the Macdonalds across the road, if you want something familiar.

Reviews.Title: “perfetto little hotel for a visit to Rome”
Reviews.Author: Karen C
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the address of this hotel we instantly felt that we had made the right choice. The entrance was very pretty, enclosed, clean and 'Italian looking' with a marble tiled floor and a scenic painted wall to greet you. You get buzzed in everything feels very safe and secure. Reception was very efficient and friendly. The room although small (104) was spotless and well maintained. Tea and coffe making comes free. Mini bar and safe in room. Interms of location, it was perfect. close to the train station (5 mins walk), surrounded by a variety of restaurants. We found the area lively and atmospheric without being rowdy. Breakfast was continental style, coffee and tea was good and there was plenty of choice to eat, yoghurts, fruit, danish pastries, ham & cheese, eggs etc. I would recommend this hotel, it was the perfect for seeing the sights and then retreating to for the night.

Reviews.Title: “Good 3 star hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: 1STTIMEBERLIN
Reviews.Content: All the good reviews are accurate - location, room breakfast etc. The only thing missing is a nice lounge where you can relax with a beer, coffee etc. The is just a small reception area with 2 computer that you can use free for internet. This would not put me off returning as from what I could see many 3 star Rome hotels did not offer this facility. Once again good location, very clean rooms and bathroom, free internet + sky sports etc, lovely continential breakfast and good helpfull staff

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Opera Roma”
Reviews.Author: KAC1947
Reviews.Content: We made on-line reservations for Hotel Sonya. We stayed for 13 nights. When we arrived to check-in, they escorted us across the street to Hotel Opera, which apparently is owned and operated by the same people. The switch was fine for us and not unexpected, because we had read about it in other reviews. Once you have made reservations, any email question that you send to them is answered quickly. I found it quite amazing. So, here are my observations. Please recognize that I am an American and have done extensive business travel (in the USA mostly) and am used to pretty nice hotels of a 3-star and 4-star level. So be sure to bear that in mind as I give my opinions. Do NOT expect your room to be the equivalent of a Marriott hotel room. If that is what you expect, then expect to pay much more elsewhere. 1. The room was neat, clean, and adequate. It was everything we expected, based on other reviews. It was small, did not have an 'easy chair' or a small table for eating in the room. Again, it was too small to accommodate those amenities and we did not expect it. It had a closet for hanging clothes, plenty of drawers, and a large safe to lock up valuables and laptops. 2. The bathroom was very nice. The towels hung on a heated rack, which was nice because we were in Rome for the first snowfall in 26 years. The shower was all-glass and very clean and suitable. My only complaint is that there were no washcloths. We made do without washcloths. Maybe if we had asked for them we'd have gotten some. (I don't like to act like an American tourist and be too demanding. I want to respect the culture of the host country) 3. The internet was free and adequate. I did not like to get a new userid and password every day, but again, there may be a very good reason for it. 4. The breakfast experience for us was a highlight of the day. The very friendly attendant made us coffee any way we pleased. For us it was cappuccino for my wife and caffe Americano for me. You couldn't buy better coffee anywhere. Plus the attendant remembered our coffee preferences each day.....made us feel quite welcomed. The tables were covered with linen tablecloths. We ate off china, nothing cheap and disposable. The room was very nice and inviting. There were cold cuts and cheese, coffee cakes, cereals, and the most delicious bread-rolls. We ate the bread-rolls every day. There were no hot scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage, etc. Again, we appreciate the culture and enjoyed what was presented. Be sure to try the bread-rolls. They look like a rosette and are crusty. We pulled them apart and ate them with butter and jam..... excellent. 5. The staff. What can I say? They were friendly, spoke English, and always immediately took care of any request (such as a burned out light, extra plastic cups, tv instructions, etc). They were also very likable and seemed eager to be of service. I wish we had used them a little more.....some of the Rome attractions were closed because of weather and the staff would have checked for us and saved us a trip. They also immediately knew the appropriate bus line to take to any attraction. They also suggested an alternative to taking the Leonardo deVinci Express Train back to the airport, saving us 16 euros. We also asked them for restaurant recommendations and were pleased with the result. So my hearty endorsement of the hotel staff. They couldn't have been better. 5. Rome is a very noisy, busy city. Some of the guests were occasionally noisy in the hallways during sleeping hours. Our room was not quiet. There was street noise. Sirens, and early morning trash pickup were clearly audible in our room. If you expect a sound-proof room you will be disappointed. 6. Hotel location was tremendous. Close to Roma Termini station and close to Via Nazionale, a main street.. Close to attractions. We took the Metro train to Saint Peter's, but walked to everything else. 7. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: thebrookes
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights here on our first trip to Rome. Excellent friendly staff who were very courteous and helpful. Our room was very clean and well kept with heating that we could control and a kettle, hairdryer and fridge. The breakfast buffet was excellent. The hotel is in a great location- about 5 mins easy walk from the main 'terminii' but very near to the city . .no more than 10-15 mins and across the road from the opera. Would definately return ! !

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best”
Reviews.Author: baronessbrown
Reviews.Content: We have just arrived back home in spain and I couldnt wait to write the review...We stayed 3 nights at this hotel,it is our 6th visit to rome,and we have stayed in two 4star hotels that wasnt as good as this one,the staff were exceptional you would think it was there business the way nothing is to much for them...a credit to the owners. The breakfast is very good,large choice....we had room 207,above average size,very warm and cosy,with lots of hot water and a whirlpool bath.....I had a sneak preview of the suite room and did it have that wow factor...A must for the next visit..Hotel is well located for all the sites......would highly recommend.....

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic hotel in Rome - well priced, clean with friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: champagneplease
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for 4 nights after a month long holiday around Europe and could not have asked for a better hotel. We arrived at Termini station late one night and decided to walk to the Hotel - it wasn't too far, however it is quite dark and scary around the station at night (a note for solo travelers), however we stuck to the main streets and found the hotel with reasonable ease. The gentleman that works at night is absolutely lovely!!! He was so warm and friendly on our arrival, helped us to our room and after staying in a number of B&B's and hostal type accommodation we were so pleased when he opened the door to a large beautiful room and large bathroom (we booked a double room with private bathroom). Air-conditioned, beautiful marble floors and well the bathroom was great - after travelling for a month we were both hoping for a room that was not too small and we were not disappointed. I had requested a room with a balcony overlooking the street and it was quite lovely. The hotel is in a good location - we walked most places and loved getting lost in the streets of Rome and finding beautiful places to eat. It was so nice to come back to the hotel at the end of the day, freshen up and then head out for dinner somewhere. I would recommend trying Hostaria Romana - an absolutely awesome restaurant - must try the carbonara and the buffalo mozzarella (I still dream about these dishes often!!). We went their twice because we loved it so much - we walked there from the hotel (as with most places in Rome)!!! Google it to find the specific location! A few things to note: if you are accustomed to large hotels, this might not be exactly what you are used to, it is a number of rooms on levels of a beautiful building that comprise of Hotel Opera (not one large building that is solely a hotel), the air-con is a must when travelling to Rome in summer, there is free wireless, TV with cable (not many english channels), breakfast in the morning (unfortunately you will need to rely on other reviews on this point, we slept in and missed it most mornings!). Also - we took advantage of the airport transfer for 40 Euro when leaving Hotel Opera - it was great (albeit a bit scary driving in Rome!!!) - we were picked up by a gentleman (he looked like Karl Lagerfield!) in a lovely black Lexus 4WD and off we were to the airport. In retrospect, I wished we had have used this when we arrived at Fiumicino, as we arrived late in the evening and the trains from the airport to Termini are not that regular and it was busy and really for 40 Euro at that time of night being picked up and driven to your hotel door is well worth it. This is offered as a service through Hotel Opera. We loved Rome and this hotel - we look forward to returning to both in the near future!

Reviews.Title: “HOTEL OPERA ROMA IS A GEM OF A SMALL HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: MauiHIBlazer
Reviews.Content: My family and I (5 adults) spent a wonderful trip in Rome in December 2011 and our stay at the Hotel Opera Roma was a wonderful experience and I strongly recommend the hotel. This is not an institutional hotel, not lavish but comfortable, inviting, and very convenient to any where you want to go in Rome. The rooms were small but comfortable, clean and especially of note is the great service and professional of the hotel staff, in particular the Front Desk. There is WiFi accessible in all the guest room and the lobby (where there also are two computer with printer access), in-room safe, confirmable beds, a mini-bar, cable TV, AC, and a speaking clean bathrooms in the guest rooms. There also is a small elevator. The people at the Front Desk are committed to making your stay pleasant and memorable. They are concerned, professional, responsive and communicative. Prior to arriving I had emailed them often and got immediate and helpful\ responses. You also can arrange airport pick-ups through them (with a company they use) and you pay the driver directly. Again, very reliable. The hotel is directly across the street from the Opera House in an area with numerous small restaurants and cafes. A block down is Via Nazionale, a major street with adorable shopping and eateries, and two short blocks from the hotel is the Republicca Metro Station and from there you can reach anywhere in Rome. For those who like walks, you can walk to the Trevi Fountain and the Victor Emmanuele Monument. And regarding the bill, I chose to pay in Euros and received a 5% discount. Overall, the Hotel Opera Roma is a gem of a small hotel and one that I would definitely return to.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and friendly”
Reviews.Author: Brian P
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights and thought it was a nice hotel. The free internet is very convenient and appreciated. The reception staff are friendly and helpful. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful accommodation :)”
Reviews.Author: JemmaKBradley
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights because I had a ticket to the opera. You couldn't ask for a more convenient location not just to Teatro dell'Opera Roma, but to a main street Via Nazionale. It's also close proximity to the buses, Piazza della Republica and Termini Stazione. My single room was lovely, but really very very extremely tiny! This would be the only reason why I wouldn't stay here again. Staff were pleasant, friendly & helpful. There is a lift, breakfast was delicious, the espresso was fantastic and to be most honest, there was nothing wrong here other than my room size.

Reviews.Title: “Third visit”
Reviews.Author: gagirl7143
Reviews.Content: This is our third visit to this hotel in 2 years. It is still well maintained and clean. the bathrooms are large and modern. The staff is more than friendly and helpful. It really has the feel of a bed and breakfast. Riza and Litu in the office try to make every request a reality. Angela is the breakfast waitress and the housekeeper for the 1st floor where we had our room. These 3 staff members made our stay wonderful, they are a huge plus for this property! Breakfast is ample and the cappuccino is perfect. The only negative was that the internet was down for 2 of the 4 days of our visit. We were able to access the internet for free at the sister hotel a half block away but this was inconvenient. We have reservations again to stay here next spring.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: Mickiedog
Reviews.Content: We stay at this hotel for 5 nights before our cruise leaving Livorno. We picked this hotel because it is very close to the central train station. We have read most of the reviews and saw most of the pictures but we were still not too sure. The driver had a difficult time to find this hotel because it has no sign in the front to indicate there is hotel in the building. We were given room 103 which faces the front, Via Firenze. The room is a nice size for European standard. Nice size bathroom but the shower is a little tight. Staff are super friendly and speak perfect English. They give very good recommendations for local restaurants around the neighbourhood. The breakfast was very good. There is always meat, eggs, cereals, yogurts, baked goods, breads and nice strong coffee! The hotel provides free WiFi which we find very helpful. The only complain we have is that Via Firenze was noisey during the weekend and we got woken up late Sat. or early Sun morning. Other than that. The place is a great place to stay at and well worth the money we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: kungpao
Reviews.Content: On arrival, I was getting more and more nervous about the hotel, as I passed street after street of sketchy hotels. As soon as I found it, though, I was instantly relieved and incredibly happy with the presentation of the hotel. The staff are very friendly and welcoming, and all speak perfect english. The room was a bit stuffy and smelled of bleach when I walked in, but at least I knew it was clean. The air conditioning worked its charm, and the room was perfect. A bit small, but considering I asked for a room for one person, it was just enough. The bathroom was nicely appointed, and the shower's water pressure amazing. Breakfast is included in the price, and is served on the ground floor next to the lobby. A great deal for the price! The only issue was that the drain in the shower wasn't working so well, but upon notifying staff, they immediately called someone to come take a look at it. All in all, very happy with the choice! The area can be a bit dodgy, but if traveling with more than one person, this shouldn't be a problem. As a single female, I wasn't always comfortable in the area, especially at night. It's about a 7 minute walk to the Termini train station, making it incredibly convenient for arrival and departure by train or plane, since the Leonardo Express has trains to/from the airport every 30 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Updated”
Reviews.Author: MortonGrove
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our last night in Rome through our reservation at Hotel Sonya. The location is great, walking distance to Termini and subway stations. Quiet street just off Via Nacional. Room was newly updated and very nice and comfortable. The towel warmer even worked and this was probably the largest shower stall of 6 hotels we stayed at. They were very good about ordering a van for our morning departure to the airport. They have a Rick Steves discount. No complaints.

Reviews.Title: “9 Nights at the Opera”
Reviews.Author: Cherylab
Reviews.Content: My spouse and I stayed nine nights here. Like some other guests we booked with the Hotel Sonya, but were transferred to the Hotel Opera Roma. At first we had our doubts, but we found the hotel staff friendly, accommodating and speaking excellent English and the hotel exceeded our expectations. Our room was clean, large and comfortable with a firm mattress and pillows. The bathroom, with a jacuzzi, was large with very hot water, but only 1/2 a shower door. (This is a style you see in Italy.) Our room was on the first floor (one flight up), but quiet and windows appeared to have double panes. Breakfast is substantial and includes home-made cakes and addictive cornetti. Hotel location is excellent, only 2 blocks from the Metro and National Museum of Rome, and 6 blocks from the train station. The hotel is around the corner from the the Rome Opera which is a excellent landmark for taxi drivers, and only 1 block from Via Nazionale for fun shopping. The hotel even offers a cash discount. We will stay there again and recommend it to all.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Toni A
Reviews.Content: We reserved this hotel off the internet and were very happy we did. It was clean and nice and the service was wonderful. The people were always very willing to help us. The location was great. Public transportation is close by and we loved the Piazza Republica. We really enjoyed it and recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice hotel in a pretty convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Sharon S
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed for four nights in the hotel, just a couple of weeks ago. We knew we were staying in this hotel, and not Hotel Sonya, so that eliminated some potential confusion. The outside sign is very very small, so you must look for the hotel based on the address. The hotel was very clean and comfortable. They held our bags and let us check in early. The breakfast (included with our room price) was quite substantial, and laptop use was free. The beds were comfortable and the room a decent size by European standards. Bonus - the hotel isn't far from the train station, and it is right next to the Opera House, perfect for coming home late after an opera or ballet, if it fits into your itinerary! I would definitely recommend the hotel and stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A Trip to the Hotel Opera Roma”
Reviews.Author: galve
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed a week at the Hotel Opera Roma. We had never stayed at the hotel and I booked it sight unseen via the Internet. Our experience was great and I would recommend it to anyone wishing a small hotel in a convenient location as the Termini Station was only a few minutes away where one can easily travel via train, bus, or metro, as well, as walk to many of the sights. We had plenty of space in our room and the room was very nice. The staff did a wonderful job of keeping it neat and clean during our stay. The staff was very professional and helpful. Reza, Angela, and Litu were especially helpful. Reza working the front desk was a wealth of information that always proved to be spot on. Overall, we had a wonderful stay and hope you do too.

Reviews.Title: “Bait and Switch”
Reviews.Author: grego344
Reviews.Content: We booked our room through expedia , when we arrived at 11a.m. we were told there were technical difficulties with the room. and wanted to switch us to their other hotel down the street When I refused to be relocated they started showing me available rooms, none looked like the pictures on the web site and none were acceptable . I agreed to look at the rooms in their Hotel Sonya and after viewing 4 rooms they finally showed me a comperable room to what I had booked online, dont know why they didn't want to give me the room I paid for in the first place. Other than the bait and switch the hotel was just fair. 2 star at best. Who needs the agrivation

Reviews.Title: “" 100% - Best Deal in Rome "”
Reviews.Author: MarcosF123
Reviews.Content: After looking for more than 80 hotel´s sites at the Internet , I found this "" Hidden Treasure "" in Rome. My Family and I stayed at the Opera Hotel for 6 nights , we got 2 Rooms ( 410 & 413 ) and it was just 100% PERFECT . All rooms are Super NEW , Modern Style , The ROOMS are bigger than the Average Room size in most Rome hotels. The Room 413 is the Biggest room and has it own Balcony . Lets go for the best of ""OPERA Hotel "" : LOCATION !!! , it is Located in the Middle of the Action , for example : Train Terminal = 800 meters ( 1/2 mile ) , Repubblica Metro Station = 400 meters ( 1/4 mile ) Colosseum = 800 meters ( 1/2 mile ) , Fontana di Trevi = 1.000 meters (2/3 mile) , Spanish Steps ( shopping area ) 1.100 meters ( 2/3 mile ) , Monument Vittorio Emanuelle = 1.000 meters ( 2/3 mile ) . Between all the GOOD things about this Hotel , Comfort , Cleaning , Location ............................. I would give a SPECIAL ATTENTION to the Hotel´s STAFF , they make you Feel Like HOME !!! On the Front Desk , you have the " charming " Valentina and the Very Special EMANUELA ( who Speaks Fluently : English , Portuguese , Spanish and French ) , they do LOVE Help and Talk to you . Do Not leave the Hotel Before have a Good and Pleasant Talking with then . Last , but not least = a "" Standing Applause "" for the Special Lady at Breakfast , Mrs. GIULIA , I have traveled all around the World , but NEVER had this Kind of Attention & Love as we got from GIULIA , I bet you will be Impressed ............................. After all , I do have to say some things NOT so PERFECT about this Hotel , the Front Desk is Located 15 Steps UP from the sidewalk , so You Do Have to care your Bags up and down this 15 steps .

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Small Hotel”
Reviews.Author: highlander44
Reviews.Content: Impeccable service and amenities. Friendly , extremely professional, courteous, helpful and knowledgable staff ... and so very kind and patient . What a beautiful property with an excellent location , very "central " and convenient to all of the most important points of interest . Rooms were immaculate , very quiet and well appointed ...beds extremely comfortable and house keeping absolutely immaculately clean. Typical Italian breakfast that was nicely expanded ,served in a gorgeous room . Included eggs and a lovely selection of meats. and fresh fruit along with all the typical Italian breakfast fare. I will never stay anywhere else when in Rome in future . This small hotel is a perfect find !

Reviews.Title: “ONE OF THE BEST CHOICES”
Reviews.Author: Stratis K
Reviews.Content: Upon our arrival, we were slightly confused about the location of the hotel since there was no obvious sign of it in the frontage of the building. In fact, the hotel is part of an apartment building where families live as well. However, the service was excellent. The kindness and the professionalism of the staff were really impressive!!! The room was comfortable, although not very big. It was very clean and luxurious. We didn't have the best view from our window but when you visit Rome staying in would be the last thing you would like to do! We were offered a free laptop and free internet access, which was very helpful in buying tickets online for the Vatican museum e.t.c.. The location of the hotel was excellent, very close to the city center and many city sights, the Rome termini and Metro. I would surely stay again in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: lorrisull
Reviews.Content: The service was excellent. Always ready to help with directions, reservations and anything we needed. The room was very clean and comfortable. The location was also very good and we found that we could travel all over Rome very easily.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: grahatd
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Opera was a really nice place to stay in Rome. It is convenient to Termini and Subway and Bus transportation. I took the train from the airport and walked the short distance to the hotel. It was easy to walk or take the subway or bus to all the sights of Rome. I bought a 7 day transit pass so it was easy to hop on a bus or subway and go where I wanted. I had a single room, which was small, but roomy enough to not feel cramped. The room was spotless and looked quite new. The marble bath was very nice as well. The breakfast room was very pretty and they served a continental breakfast that was very good and got my day off to a good start. I will stay here again on my next trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Linda531
Reviews.Content: This small hotel offers the perfect location for visiting Rome. Within easy walking distance from the train station, Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain and Metro. Room was small but clean and comfortable. Very reasonable rates with a nice breakfast included. Front desk staff was pleasant and helpful. Safe neighborhood across from the Opera House.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! Everything was perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Sasha88_11
Reviews.Content: The room was very clean and well furnished, plenty of space as well. The bathroom was great! Room service was comprehsive and I think went above and beyond, even folded up some clothes i had all over the place. The staff were very very helpful and freindly and spoke great english, french also i think. Breakfest was nice and there were many options and coffee was made to order. The hotel was located in a great part of the city, a quite side street in a great clean and safe part of the city. We walked to every main attraction in city with out the need to use public transport. Can't say enough good things about our stay with this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: brandweer
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 6 days in Rome. We had booked 2 rooms for hotel Sonya but on arrival we had to transfer across the street to hotel Opera Roma. The hotel was excellent. Breakfast was more than expected. The hotel staff was very friendly and helphull. Very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fatheroftwokids
Reviews.Content: This was our first stop of our Europe trip and the hotel made the transition very easy. We reached the hotel at around 9:30 in the morning after taking the shuttle from the airport. The front desk person was very friendly and offered us a free breakfast even though we had not begun our stay there. Within about an hour, the room was ready and we checked-in earlier than expected. The person gave us a free netbook for our stay. There was some issue with the netbook connecting to internet, but they sorted it out by the evening. He recommended some nice restaurants in the neighborhood which were excellent. The hotel is within walking distance of two train stations Republica (5 min) and Termini (8-10 min), which made it very easy to see all the sites we wanted to see in Rome. Everything except Vatican was within walking distance anyway. The rooms were comfortable with adequate size (in Europe they tend to be smaller anyway). We had selected a room for four, which had one double and two singles. Breakfast was good, nothing fancy, but adequate. The hotel is on a side street, off a big central street (via Nazionale). This is the perfect combination for us, no noise, but ready access to everything including a Despar supermarket, ATMs, buses on the main street. Highly recommended for family stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Rome!!”
Reviews.Author: yoliemar6
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Opera Roma on the recommendation of a friend and we were not dissappointed! We wanted a hotel that was walking distance to Termini Staton and this was located within a 15min walk. We were traveling with minimal luggage and we easily walked to Termini Station to catch an early train to Salerno on our last day in Rome, but if your traveling with more luggage, it may be a bit too far. We also easily walked to one of the many metro train stations and arrived at Vatican City with 2-3 stops and also the Coliseum in no time. There were many restuarants to choose from and the staff was very friendly and helpful. Our room was very spacious with modern decor and the AC was great!! We would definately stay here again should we return to Rome. It was an execellent choice and a great rate for this type of room quality in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great customer service”
Reviews.Author: tayeret
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights at the Hotel Opera Roma, and really were pleased with our stay. We chose it because it was near the train station. When we arrived, we found that it was a few blocks away and the map was somewhat confusing, but we found our way easily enough. It was also walking distance to many Rome tourist attractions, but there was always a bit of a walk to get there. However, it was very convenient to buses and metro. The room itself was typical small European room, but it was certainly adequate, and we were comfortable. The best thing the hotel had to offer, as far as we were concerned, was their customer service. The people at the desk were so helpful with directions and advice. They really helped us get our bearings in a very large and confusing and city. One of them was also kind enough to lend us an umbrella when it suddenly started pouring as we were heading out to a laundromat. The breakfasts were a wonderful way to start each day. I would definitely recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous place to stay in the beautiful chaos of Rome!”
Reviews.Author: embransteter
Reviews.Content: We opted for a real "hotel" in Rome rather than the B&Bs we stayed in in smaller cities because we liked that there was staff on hand 24 hours a day. This hotel was also recommended by Rick Steves. We wanted to stay within walking distance of the train station, and this location was excellent. We were happy with how quiet it was despite being in the heart of the city. It is off a side street, and we walked everywhere except the Vatican - which was a 4 minute walk to the Metro! Tons of restaurants and shopping around. There's an Irish Pub and McDonald's just around the corner if you want something you are familiar with, and they're open ALL day. Every staff member we encountered was helpful and friendly. They helped us arrange a transport to the airport and had a very helpful map with the popular sights highlighted. Breakfast was wonderful with many options - eggs, yogurt, croissants, cereal, fruit, juice, coffee, and tea. Our room and bathroom were adequate size. Most things are smaller in Italy, but we had plenty of room. The room was very clean, and the bed was huge! There were TV channels in English, too. The coffee and tea in the room was great to help us wake up from a siesta - the only way to do Rome without complete exhaustion! The free wireless access was fast, and when our password stopped working, the front desk simply gave us another one. I would stay here again if I visit Rome!

Reviews.Title: “ok hotel”
Reviews.Author: primerib74
Reviews.Content: located by the Opera in Rome. Very difficult to find as the signing in not good. He had to ask a man working in the internet cafe down the street. Rooms had recently been redone and they are very nice but small. ONly 14 rooms in the hotel. Front desk staff is very nice and the breakfast was good. The only real complaint is the we would have rather stayed in the older section of Room

Reviews.Title: “Great find!”
Reviews.Author: WellyWoo09
Reviews.Content: My husband and I along with four of our family members stayed at the Hotel Opera for 4 nights in early June. The hotel was fantastic! Prior to our arrival, they were very accomodating, assisting me with booking trasportation from the airport to the hotel. Upon arrival, we were greeted at the door with warm smiles and helping hands to carry our bags. The hotel was spotless & our room was well appointed including the bathroom which had a gorgeous tub perfect for soaking after a long day of sightseeing. Breakfast simple but good and the staff always pleasant during every interaction. The location was perfect too- it was easy to walk to Termini Station and just a short ride from all the major sights. Hotel Opera was really a wonderful find! If we ever travel back to Rome, we will absolutely be staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT value in the Heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: docbones
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Opera Roma, which is located in the heart of Rome. We chose it because it was only $165/euro's a night compared to 300-600 euro's a night at other surrounding hotels. The staff was friendly, familiar with the in's and out's of Rome and were of enormous help. Our room was spare, clean, had a TV, air conditioning, bathtub (important for me). There was no spa, no fitness room or swimming pool. They also had a fabulous breakfast and loved their cafe latte's they made from scratch. Their breakfast was sumptuous, the food fresh and everything spotless. They suggested since we were staying 5 nights with them, an Italian restaurant, Antica Boehome, and it's FABULOUS! We at there every night. Fab service, food fresh and delicious...this is true Italian cooking at it's finest--and very cheap in comparison to other places---a little hole in the wall off on a side street. We will be back, and we'll use Hotel Opera Roma as our center to walk to see all the incredible sites that Roma has to offer. We loved our stay. The room was quiet, non-smoking. It had a good internet connection and phone.

Reviews.Title: “Small, but perfect in every way”
Reviews.Author: alie01
Reviews.Content: My friend and I recently stayed at the Hotel Opera for 4 nights on a 2 week tour of Italy. It provided a quiet peaceful place to relax after a busy and hot day sight seeing in Rome. Although the room was very small it was comfortable and spotlessly clean. Breakfast was enjoyable, and the friendly and competent staff were a bonus. Great location for everything - including some good local restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Family time for bonding and discovering our Italian heritage”
Reviews.Author: Dianadean
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took all of our adult children to Italy for a family vacation in November 2010. We visited Venice, Florence, and Rome. Rome was our last stop. I cannot express enough the wonderful communications I had with every member of Hotel Opera's staff prior to my trip and while I was there. The staff did everything they could to accommodate my entire family including 2 room changes. I worked in the hotel business so I know how stressful it can be to accommodate room changes so that your guests are comfortable. This staff handled the situation with ease and professionalism. By the time we left I felt like I was leaving friends. They even arranged a van to take us to the airport that was very reasonable. Our driver seemed like a tour guide rather than a van driver. If you want a staff that looks for ways to make your stay wonderful this is the hotel! The rooms were clean and attractive. The breakfast was delicious. The location was perfect. I have already recommended the hotel to a cousin. But the staff was the very best!!!! Bravo

Reviews.Title: “Our Second Stay”
Reviews.Author: Andy29650
Reviews.Content: Hotel Opera Roma was so great a value four years ago that we returned with friends this year. The hotel is conveniently located near Roma Termini and restaurants on a quiet side street beside the Opera House. The rooms are modern and comfortable. Breakfast is in an attractive room with a variety of food choices. The best aspect of this hotel is the staff. The front desk personnel were especially knowledgable and helpful. The breakfast room was well-run, and the rooms were kept neat and clean. Tips: Two convenient restaurants with good food, fair prices and local flavor: Ristorante da Giovanni ( on the corner of XX Settembre and via Salandra) and Strega ( two blocks from the hotel)

Reviews.Title: “Very kind and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: grethejorg
Reviews.Content: The suite was perfect to a family with two teenagers as you could stay together. If the adults have been on their own, an armchair would be fine

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful information and efficient service at the front desk.”
Reviews.Author: DLKWI88
Reviews.Content: The room was spotless with three very comfortable single beds. Large bathroom, also spotless. Great location next to a major landmark (the Opera House), so it was easy to find your way back. Room was not very well-lit but each bed had a reading lamp over it so that compensated for it. The personnel at the front desk were extremely friendly, extremely helpful, and gave us many tips and advice that saved us time and money. The one time we asked them to call a cab for us (we didn't feel like making the short walk to the train station while schlepping our luggage), it arrived within MOMENTS - truly, the time it took us to walk from the front desk outside to the curb and the cab was pulling up. Incredible!

Reviews.Title: “Spring break in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Peadar18
Reviews.Content: Excellent Hotel, staff were friendly and informative, there advise for restaurants was spot on. The location is within easy walking distance of most attractions and close to the Metro. I would highly recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “There are too many hotels in Rome to stay at this one”
Reviews.Author: BLT1991
Reviews.Content: I stayed her one night with a family of 4 (2 teenagers) on our last night in Italy…we staged here before an early flight the next morning. The hotel had received fairly high marks on Trip Advisor and was mentioned in Rick Steves, but it didn’t measure up. It is not in a charming part of town…there is no sign out front for the hotel…which makes me wonder a bit. When we arrived, there was some “issue” with our intended room, so they “upgraded” us to their “special room” and then gave us the room next door for the kids. Space-wise, it was fine and the room looked fancy…but like a façade built over an old structure…the fancy suite wasn’t all that. The bathroom was in a grotto downstairs with a hot tub (it all briefs well and makes for a nice picture)…but the hot tub was cold. The bathroom was extremely hot…driven by an overactive towel warmer. There was a fancy Jacuzzi shower…but none of the controls worked…and the water wouldn’t stay at a constant temperature…it tended to get dangerously hot. The entire suite reeked of chlorine. There was broken glass on the floor…which my daughter found with her bare foot. My wife came away with some suspicious bug bites on her feet…fortunately, we think they were fleas and not bed bugs. The breakfast was mediocre at best…the worst we had had in Italy. There are too many hotels in Rome to waste your time and money at this one.

Reviews.Title: “A memorable visit to Rome”
Reviews.Author: LeeBerkshireEngland
Reviews.Content: Originally booked to stay in Hotel Sonia, on arrival told we were staying at their new hotel across the road we were not disappointed, staff were friendly and very helpful, good location we walked to most of the attractions,but bus and metro (termini) are all near by to get to the Vatican and Colosseum. The breakfast room was very small, you had a choice of cereal,eggs,cake, yogurts,croissants,rolls and fresh fruit with tea and coffee. Recommend a great restaurant around the corner from hotel called Sapori Nuovie on via delle Fontane.

Reviews.Title: “Value and Location - what else can I say?”
Reviews.Author: AlabamaAnne
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a tiny bit "no frills" but is located in a perfect spot to explore Rome by foot, which is what we did. The hoteliers provided a good breakfast, with fruit, yogurt, eggs, cheese, baked goods including cakes and pastry, and excellent coffee. The rooms are small (it's the heart of Rome!) but well outfitted. We had three to a room (parents and 19 year old), and it was a tad tight. There was good security, too. The bathroom was quite nice. Being on a side street, the room and hotel were fairly quiet at night, too. Free internet was a very welcome finding. It's not the Grand Regency, but the hotel was much more than adequate for our needs, and not overpriced at all.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, close to Termini station”
Reviews.Author: j_irina2006
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel for my friends in case 2-3 days trip. Quiet place but close to Termini station and 15-20 min. walk by foot to sightseeing. It is very small breakfast room.

Reviews.Title: “friendly en welcoming hotel”
Reviews.Author: italyfreak1970
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very good for a citytrip. It's central and all the main attractions are in the neighbourhood. The hotelpersonnel are very friendly en welcoming. The breakfast is ok. The room are very clean and each day the room cleaned. This is a wonderfull hotel and I would advise erveybody to go this hotel. There is a supermarket in the neighbourhood (at the corner).

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed overall”
Reviews.Author: cath32
Reviews.Content: Just home from our stay in Rome. Had booked the hotel Sonya, but were given a room here. This hotel has alot of pro's, but unfortunately for us the con's out weighed them ! yes it is only five mins from Termini, a minute walk from Via Nazionale which has bus connections, friendly enough staff and is very clean. However while we were there we had the following issues - - drip from towel heater in the very small bathroom was reported 3 times over 2 days before it was finally fixed. We had to put towels down on the bathroom floor so we wouldn't slip, and had to lay awake ( even with bathroom door closed) listening to the drip drip drip drip aaarrghghh. - room was very cold and by the second morning we asked reception if it was possible to turn up heating as aircon controls didnt seem to be working. ( didnt complain the day before as in true irish style we didnt want to seem like we were complainers and were more concerned with the constant drip at that stage !!). Anyway the reply from reception was that a technician would be here to fix it today, they were aware of the prblem, was a bit annoyed that we were put in a room with these problems considering we hadn't even booked this hotel. -small breakfast room and 2 of the 4 mornings we were there we had to wait for a table, dont know how many rooms are in this hotel but there are 2 tables that seat 4 and 4 tables that seat 2 in the breakfast room. -mouldy fruit in the fruit bowl, and same cakes there for 4 mornings, gradually getting staler. -check out is at 11a.m, my husband asked how much it would be to keep the room til 4p.m, we taught €70 was excessive, considering the room with breakfast was on average €84 per night if paying cash. - 2 computers with free internet access in reception area, but with very slow connection and often bombed out. I'm sure its possible to find a better hotel for the price paid in the termini area.

Reviews.Title: “Really really clean. Staff vey helpful. Ideal location”
Reviews.Author: TUCKEN
Reviews.Content: New rooms. Very very clean. Great bathrooms.Good location 10 mins from main train station. Staff really helpfuf. Excellent breakfast. Good restaurants very close by.

Reviews.Title: “Another wonderfu stay!”
Reviews.Author: gagirl7143
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at Hotel Opera Roma and again we were especially pleased again with our stay. Our room was immaculately clean. The photos on their website are definitely representative of the rooms. The Staff is extremely friendly, helpful and very knowledgeable. This hotel feels much more like a B&B. Litu, Eta, Riza or Simone are always at the front desk. Angela is in charge of breakfast which is very adequate. We highly recommend this charming hotel and will be staying there for a third time next Fall! One feels like a member of the family while staying here. The location is fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Okay for the price”
Reviews.Author: lacybass
Reviews.Content: Pros-Hotel is in a convenient location near Termini and the Repubblica Subway stop. Rooms were clean and staff helpful. Also our lowest-priced hotel in Italy (under 70 Euro for a double with cash) in November. Cons-Worst breakfast out of 4 hotels in Italy, many of the pastries/breads tasted hard/stale. FYI-We originally made reservations at Hotel Sonya (4 months prior) but were still placed at Hotel Opera Roma which I think is a common occurence. We were upgraded to the suite. The suite is spacious but in an odd configuration. Bathroom/jacuzzi are on the bottom floor, bed on the 2nd floor, and 2 other small beds are in the loft. The bottom level is very humid and pretty hot despite 2 dehumidifers being near the jacuzzi. There is no window or good ventilation on this level. The 2nd level also was quite warm and felt humid and too warm, even in November. The air-conditioning never came on as you can only lower it to a specific level. Although the hotel was a good value and overall it was fine, if we go to Rome again we would pay more to stay in another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - definitely recommend!”
Reviews.Author: eyylim
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel, the staff are friendly and the rooms are clean and nicely furnished. The hotel is next to the metro which makes it easy to get around and also close to one of the tourist bus stops. We would definitely stay in this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: physicsgeek
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel in a busy city. It's conveniently located to Stazione Termini - about a 5 minute walk. It's location is perfect for accessing Rome's attractions. My wife and I occupied a room with a king bed during the first week of November. The bed was very comfortable and the price was very reasonable. We took advantage of their 10% discount on the room rates by paying in cash and booking on-line. Although the room was small, it was very clean, comfortable and quiet - no complaints. The staff was very accommodating and friendly. They were happy to make reservations for us at galleries, their eating recommendations were spot on, and they provided accurate directions to our destinations. We enjoyed a plentiful breakfast each morning. The minibar prices are the best - very inexpensive compared to local stalls. The hotel has free internet which we found very useful. We would definitely use this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic hotel - it was my home away from home”
Reviews.Author: holidayfunMelbourne
Reviews.Content: I was nervous about staying in Rome as a female traveller alone however felt perfectly safe and comfortable at the Hotel Opera Rome. It was my home away from home. The staff were absolutely fantastic – so friendly and helpful in particular Silvia, Eta and Giovanna. The hotel had free Sky TV with numerous English channels and free internet which I did not see in many other hotels on my trip. It was only 10 minutes walk from the Spanish Steps and just around the corner from the public transport. The room and public areas were clean, comfortable, modern and so quiet. I could not fault the service and facilities. I will definitely return on my next visit to Rome. Thank you to everyone at Hotel Opera for making my first visit to Rome so memorable..10/10.

Reviews.Title: “Would not hesitate to return”
Reviews.Author: FDPevey
Reviews.Content: Good location - wonderful little restaurant right up the street. The king bed room for my husband and me was spacious, had a little quasi-balcony that overlooked the street, and a huge bathroom. The single room for my sister was REALLY small, but it was priced accordingly and the bathroom worked well for a single. Everything was spotless and the beds were wonderfully comfortable. The Sky TV was a great feature - after touring all day it was actually a pleasure to relax and watch TV (once I figured out how to change the language to English - easy when you know how). Breakfast was tasty. Mini-bar prices are reasonable, good to be able to grab a glass of wine when relaxing. If you want a great sleep, a clean room, and a good value - this is the place! DEPARTURE HINT: Leave at least THREE HOURS to check in at the airport when leaving from Rome. I thought the advice the hotel staff gave us was nuts - especially for a 7 a.m. flight, but I was glad we listened. It was a nightmare end to a great trip - we were in line to check in for 2.5 hours! Had we done the usual US two hours before take-off, we would have missed our plane.

Reviews.Title: “very friendly and helpful”
Reviews.Author: cjeMelbourne
Reviews.Content: It was hard to find Hotel Opera Roma but when we did we were welcomed and it was a very comfortable room. Breakfast was very good. We got down there late and they still served us. They stored our luggage for a late dparture and ordered a car to the airport at a very reasonable cost. Hotel Opera Roma is part of Hotel Sonya and if we had known it would have been easier to find. It is walking distance from the station adn all the sights. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Denise186605
Reviews.Content: I stayed with friends in this hotel in October, we stayed in a suite the room was spotless and very big, the bathroom was particularly luxurious. The staff was very helpful and friendly and the hotel is located close to all the main attractions. I would definitely recommend this hotel and I will stay there again whenever I am lucky enough to be in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: judym67
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice stay at the hotel in early October. We loved the proximity to both Roma Termini and 2 metro stations as well as the easy walking to many of Rome's sights. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Our room was quite nice, having been fairly recently renovated, and was very clean. We liked the breakfast that was offered. There were many choices of things to eat and the coffee was excellent. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “A relaxing oasis in a bustling big city.”
Reviews.Author: Hollidaze_8
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel opera for three days in September and then again for two days in October. The location was wonderful - very close to the termini train station and within walking distance of most of the tourist attractions in Rome. Breakfast was very good and the staff very accomodating and friendly. The first time we stayed there we had a larger room with a jacuzzi and when we came back, we ended up with a much smaller room. We just mentioned that fact to the receptionist and the next day they put us in a suite with a private hot tub! Obviously they care about keeping their customers happy! Would defintely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful little hotel”
Reviews.Author: SunCitySteve
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had the pleasure of staying at the Hotel Opera Roma for three days this past September. The staff was very helpful and friendly Thanks Raza!! The location is on a small, quiet street about 5 blocks from the Termini train station. The Metrro stop at the Termini allowed us to get where we wanted to go without a lot of walking, but we did choose to walk to the Spanish Steps one evening just because we were in Rome! The breakfast at the hotel each morning was a delight, lots of things to choose from and uniformly good. The cafe latte was exceptional! When we are in Rome again we will stay at this wonderful little gem.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Service”
Reviews.Author: rachel524
Reviews.Content: After confining in a flight for over 10 hours, my friend and i arrived Rome in early morning and came to the Hotel Opera Roma at about 8.30am. The staff (Ms. Silvia) was so kind to try her best to arrange us an early check-in, and also offer us cups of coffee, which indeed made a very good start of my journey in Italia. Also, the hotel is quite near to the Metro. Also, the room is clean and tidy though not a very big one.

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: Lenahl
Reviews.Content: Easy walk from the train station and close to metro and sights. There are also cafes and stores nearby. The Indian gentleman at the front desk was very helpful and hardworking making our stay that much better. The hotel is small and the rooms are small but clean. Our windows opened out onto the street which was nice. Breakfast was good too. Overall good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel after one month in Europe”
Reviews.Author: AnaAmaral
Reviews.Content: I stayed in 5 differents hotels in 5 cities during my vacation in Europe an the best hotel of my trip was, by far, the Opera Roma. The location was better than I expected, the room was also wonderful and the service was amazing. The girl who served us during the breakfast was really nice e most of all, the gentlemen from the front desk, Lito, is a very polite and helpful guy.

Reviews.Title: “CIAO ROMA!”
Reviews.Author: acc25
Reviews.Content: Gotta tell you how wonderful this hotel was! Especially the morning buffet breakfast! Clean and afordable located in a safe neighborhood. Its minutes for the train station and walking distance to most major attractions! We walked all the way to the Vatican and then took the Metro back. It was a truly a memorable experience for all of us. The staff is very helpful and a map was provided showing the locations of the major sites. Highly recommend this hotel for anyone passing through Rome. We we were there for 3 nights!

Reviews.Title: “The suite is SWEEETTTT”
Reviews.Author: ABlueAngel
Reviews.Content: love the fact that's its a short distance a way from Termini station so we walked from the station to the hotel. We were surprised by the upgrade and got the suite. It's sweeetttt. If the hot tub and jacuzzi shower worked during our stay it's definitely a 5 but since it was broken the whole time we were there (4 nights), I have to give it a 4. But, the room though is really nice. It's nice to go back to a clean hotel after a whole day of venturing the city. The service staff are very nice, friendly, and helpful. I would definitely go back to this place again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: kdgross
Reviews.Content: We would definitely choose Hotel Opera Roma for our next stay in Rome. This is a lovely hotel that is only 5 minutes walking to the main train terminal in Rome. The Colosseum, Trevi Fountain, and other major attractions are all within walking distance. Best of all, it’s a very well kept hotel and the staff is friendly and helpful with anything you need, directions, restaurants, international phone options, etc. All around delightful.

Reviews.Title: “Good amenities, quiet, clean, comfortable and close to Termini station.”
Reviews.Author: rajna
Reviews.Content: Very quiet with good amenities (computer access in room, coffee maker, TV to watch ESPN). Staff was helpful. Morning breakfast was cheerful and a nice way to start the day of sightseeing. Close to Termini station for easy transportation without paying for taxi rides. The only negative was that the hot water fluctuated with cold during a shower. We slept well in the hotel and would not hesitate to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay in a central location”
Reviews.Author: sueO_RonR
Reviews.Content: I had booked on other users recommendations and when we arrived we were placed in a new area of the hotel (across the road in another building in fact) which was recently completed. The room was new and of typical size for Rome 3star; everything worked and we also had a little balcony onto the street. Price was good so we would be happy to stay here again for a short time.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, helpful staff, clean modern rooms”
Reviews.Author: SeattleCrazyhair
Reviews.Content: It is close (walking distance) to the main train station and the subway. It is a good location for site seeing. Our room was modern, quiet and clean - a little small, but fine. The breakfast room was a little crowded, but the food was good. The front desk staff was very helpful and pleasant (even when dealing with some other guests who were being really rude). They set us up with a private driver to the airport, which was less expensive (for 3 people) than a taxi and more convenient than taking the train.

Reviews.Title: “Jacuzzi Tub”
Reviews.Author: PinoSpringTime
Reviews.Content: These rooms are amazing, spacious, luxurious, and AIR CONDITIONED! We loved the jacuzzi tub and small balcony overlooking the street below. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice peacefull hotel in the center of the city”
Reviews.Author: Ivana2010
Reviews.Content: The rooms are recently renovated and the hotel is very clean. The staff is helpful and cordial, the location is excellent (near the Termini station and a large street but nevertheless quiet), and breakfast very nice and satisfactory. The only negative point was the size of the room, but for Rome standards nothing unusual.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, cozy, and great location.”
Reviews.Author: Tummy_tum
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel Opera Roma in July for a total of 7 nights, 5 nights the first stay and then 2 nights the second stay. Both stays were excellent. Rooms: The rooms were both small, but definitely served our needs. There was a mini-fridge with a selection of drinks, a fairly large wardrobe, and a desk for a computer or for reading. There was also a kettle with coffee if desired, and we were able to ask the staff for tea when we wanted. The bed was very comfortable and everything was very clean. The bathroom was also a bit small, but in Europe, hotel rooms are always small. There was a full shower, and the counter wasn't huge, but all in all I have no complaints at all. Location: Simply excellent. Just minutes away from Main Termini, just like advertised, and also very close to Piazza de Republique (where there is also a metro on the red line). It's also very close to Via Nationale, which is a large street in Rome that has a lot of shopping and eateries. Walking in the area was great and it was easy to get on a bus or the metro whenever we wanted. Misc: We got the rooms for what we think was a great deal so we were very happy. Breakfast was included - they served salami/prosciutto, boiled eggs, various pastries, yogurt, coffee/tea/orange juice, and fresh fruit. Definitely more than enough for a great start to the day. Free wireless internet, and there are also a few computers in the lobby in case you need them. The staff were excellent, ESPECIALLY Litu in the front desk - just superb. We didn't have any problems with noise or anything like that. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, modern hotel in great location with excellent service & amenities!”
Reviews.Author: ColleensJourneys
Reviews.Content: My stay at Hotel Opera Roma was wonderful! The hotel is brand new and top-quality. The location is great – on a quiet street across from the Teatro Opera – while also close to Termini and Repubblica Metro stations – making it easy to get to major sites and attractions. There are many good restaurants in the neighborhood. And the National Museum of Rome is only a couple blocks away. The rooms and bathrooms are modern and well appointed, spotlessly clean and had lovely amenities. The bed was very comfortable – I slept well! The breakfast was delicious and plentiful with a nice variety of pastries (homemade at their sister hotel, Hotel Sonya, down the street), eggs, yogurts, cold cuts and cheese, as well as tea, juice, excellent coffee, and pleasant service. The hotel has aircon and an elevator. The free Wi-Fi was an added bonus. The double & triple rooms are quite spacious, though the single room I saw was quite small, but still modern with a well-appointed bathroom. I had the pleasure of meeting both Nicoli, the owner, and Francesca, the hotel manager. I appreciated their warm hospitality and helpfulness. The staffs at both hotels – the Opera and Sonya (sister hotels with same owner and some shared staff) – provided outstanding and friendly service. They answered my questions patiently – giving me good directions and tips for sightseeing and restaurants and arranged prompt taxi service to the airport at a fair price. Many thanks to Rezza, Silvia, Litu, Farhed (who makes delicious breakfast pastries and cakes each morning), Joy, the lovely woman serving breakfast at Hotel Opera Roma, and all the other helpful staff. I thank everyone for such a positive experience! I highly recommend this hotel to anyone wanting excellent service and an enjoyable experience in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “We'd stay here again!!!!”
Reviews.Author: rakherm
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay. The hotel is nicely decorated with very modern furniture and the hotel room is very clean. It is not on a noisy street and the balcony is a nice touch. The elevator is rather antiquated and be aware that it does not accommodate 2 or more occupants carrying luggage. Staff is wonderful and very attentive. Breakfast was good and in such a luxurious breakfast room, and loved the coffee! Each cup was made to order.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels I have stayed in!!”
Reviews.Author: Vicknesh
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 3 nights for on our honeymoon (last week). I will say that this has got to be the best hotel I have stayed in for the price we paid. We paid EUR87/night (cash) with breakfast. The room was very spacious (by European standards) and it was very clean. The hotel was centrally located as we could walk to most of the major tourist spots (if you don't mind walking under the summer sun)... The hotel reception staffs (I spoke to the day and evening shift guys) were really nice and friendly. They gave us good directions and tips on what to do in Rome. Good chaps both of them. The 1 improvement I could think of was their breakfast menu. It was not bad but I think they could do a bit better in terms of their selections of pastries. Did I mention that the hotel comes with free wi-fi and you can request for netbook from the reception! :) I appreciated this very much since we were in Rome right after visiting Paris and the hotel in Paris charged us for wi-fi (EUR5 for 1 hour!!!)... In summary: A great hotel. Centrally located. Great staff and service. Spacious and very comfortable rooms/beds. Breakfast menu can be improved. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone!!

Reviews.Title: “Central location close to Trevi Fountain and Colosseum”
Reviews.Author: Calgary14
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised at the size of the family suite. Three floors including a jaccuzi in the basement. My only issue was that the room has little natural light, but it had a lot of room for 2 adults and 2 teenage boys. The staff were always helpful and pleasant and breakfast adequate. Its a central location: Its 5 minutes to Republica Metro station, 15 mins to Trevi Fountain, 20 mins to Colosseum. From Barberini statiion its 20 mins to the Pantheon.

Reviews.Title: “HOTEL OPERA ROMA--VERY HAPPY!!”
Reviews.Author: ChazotteJ
Reviews.Content: The staff is extremely helpful to travellers with directions, tours and internet service. Mr. Litu and Reza were always willing to help us with our endless questions and they made you feel at home in their hotel. It is a small, modern, clean hotel that is near the Metro, Termini Station, buses, shopping and restaurants. It is on a quiet street across from the Opera house...a little hard to locate at first without obvious signs but that should not detract you from staying here. We thoroughly enjoyed Rome and would recommend this hotel to anyone planning a stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Estupendo-Great!”
Reviews.Author: montse05
Reviews.Content: Muy buen unicado, al lado teatro Opera y estaciuon Termini y autobuses Ideal para hacer turismo Staff del hote amabilísima.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!! Would stay again!!”
Reviews.Author: hdunlap
Reviews.Content: The Staff at the Hotel Opera Roma were ALL very kind and helpful throughout our visit and my friend and I very much enjoyed our 2 night stay there! I had read about this hotel in the Rick Steves' book and then read reviews online. This hotel is a great value for Rome. It is walking distance to/from the Termini train station which was convenient and not too difficult to find as it is very close to the Opera Theater. We felt very safe at the hotel (needed key to get into building/and of course rooms) We had free breakfast with cappuccinos and juice in the mornings. We also were given small lap tops with free internet service for our stay. The hotel does have a lift and the rooms were clean, had decent beds,hot showers,telephone,security safe and television. If I travel to Rome again this is where I would stay!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expections.”
Reviews.Author: jts115
Reviews.Content: Only stayed one night. We had a triple and a double. The triple was amazing! Hotel was very clean and everything was in good working order. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, frendly people.”
Reviews.Author: Chuly26
Reviews.Content: Great location, nice helpful people, good breakfast, good bathoroom, air condition, good price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CalgaryHappycamper
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the first week of June, 2010. This is a great hotel close to the train station and with walking distance from a number of the major historical sites. The rooms were large and well maintained. A hotel like this one helped make our trip very enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Above and beyond the majority of Rome hotels”
Reviews.Author: Tizmania
Reviews.Content: Finally, a modern and clean hotel on a quiet street in the heart of Rome! I sifted through so many expensive Roman dumps, that the Opera was quite a find. A 8 minute walk from Termini station, tucked in behind Piazza Republica - on a whisper quiet street behind the Opera Centre. The entrance of the hotel is not obvious, but once buzzed in, the experience is great. Clean, and very modern - with luxurious room appointments. The rate was good, when paying by cash - and the service and breakfast were also very good. Their pastries especially were great! My only recommendation to the hotel is to get proper desk chairs for your internet stations. The ones you have are far from comfortable. A very minor blip, in an otherwise stellar stay. Thank you Hotel Opera!

Reviews.Title: “Best night of sleep”
Reviews.Author: DSAustin
Reviews.Content: Hotel was new and nice. Staff was friendly. Beds were amazing and the best night of sleep on our trip. A little on the high price, but again it's Rome! Great location near Termini makes it easy to get to the trains.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, friendly staff, very clean”
Reviews.Author: BeoneHere
Reviews.Content: I liked the location, we were able to walk everywhere The staff was very friendly and helpful THe room was clean and i liked the 110v option in the bathroom because I forgot my converter. I would definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “A great boutique hotel in the heart of the old city”
Reviews.Author: Halifaxduo
Reviews.Content: We chose the Hotel Opera Roma for the 7day Rome leg of our trip to Italy based on the positive reviews here on TA. Thanks to all who took the time to share their impressions. The hotel did not disappoint. It is a small boutique hotel on a quiet one-way street in the heart of the old city. The Teatro Opera is just across the street. For some reason Taxi drivers had diffiiculty finding this hotel, so we began asking them to take us to the Teatro, instead. The location is hard to beat. It is just a half-block to the bustling shopping and transportion routes of Via Nazionale. There is a Metro station nearby and several good restaurants in the neighbourhood. Many of the well known tourist sites are within walking distance. We tended to walk to the sites, stopping at cafes alomg the way, and then take a taxi, bus or Metro back at the end of the day. The hotel has a small but comfortable lounge, a nicely appointed breakfast room and 10 newly renovated hotel rooms, We booked a King bed room with a balcony through the hotel's internet site. Upon arrival we got exactly what we had requested. The intelligent design of the room resulted in ample storage space and comfortable movement within the room. The decor gave the room a calm and sophisticated look. The small but modern bathroom included a walk-in shower. The mini-bar was stocked with soda, water and birra at prices less that the street vendors. The lounge included two computers with free access to the internet. Having access to the internet meant that we learned that the departure time for our flight home was changed, which resulted in less waiting time at the airport. The staff at the front desk were friendly and helpful. A special thanks to Mr Litu who not only fixed the safe in our room and the cable connection to the TV but also offered restaurant recommendations, made reservations, and provided us with a bucket of ice cubes at the end of each afternoon. The breakfast room had a pleasant atmosphere. The breakfast buffet had a good selection of brioche, croissants, potatoe onion pie, fruit, cheese and pasteries. Your choice of coffee or chocalata caulda is delivered to the table with a pitcher of orange juice. The waitress was efficient but not particularly friendly. At first, we thought she was having a bad day but her demeanor did not change during the week, A couple of cautions. We noticed that there is another hotel called the Opera Hotel not far away. Be careful when booking to make sure you are at the Hotel Opera Roma. The hotel is owned by the same people who own the Sonya Hotel which is just down the street.. It can be confusing for new arrivals. At the entrance there is a brass plate sign with the Sonya Hotel name and a smaller brass sign with the Hotel Opera Roma name. The breakfast room has the Sonya name on it and the brochures at reception and in the rooms are for the Sonya Hotel. It is as if the owners have not yet decided whether to market the Hotel Opera Roma as a separate hotel, or as an annex of the Sonya Hotel. We recommend that the owners feature the unique qualities of this great liitle hotel, rather than blurring its identity with the Sonya.

Reviews.Title: “Skippable”
Reviews.Author: Mahjarunner
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel from June 2 through June 5, 2010 (4 nights). We originally were assigned to room 106, which was terrible. The bathtub leaked all over the floor, the air conditioner made a gushing sound (what the fluid rattling around up there was is anyone's guess), the street noise overnight was unbearable, and there was some sort of compressor that made a terrible noise from 8am until 9am, but was then shut off. For the first time ever in many years of travelling in Europe, I requested a room change, and it was immediately granted. We asked for a move to an upper floor facing away from the street, and they took care of moving us while we went out and saw the sights, which was nice. They didn't seem too concerned about the reasons why we wanted to move though, and over the next 4 days, I heard 3 other people request room changes that also went unquestioned. This leads me to believe they were either putting people back in room 106, or they get a lot of complaints. That said, we were totally fine with our new room which was 214. It was very quiet, smaller, had fewer amenities, and no view. We paid 170 euros per night and they didn't discount that despite moving us to a smaller room and having such a bad experience with the first night, which I thought was a little tacky on their part. I also don't see how this is a 3 star hotel. The guys at the front desk were foreigners, but honestly, they were some of the nicest people in Rome. The only exception was the Italian woman who staffed the breakfast area on weekdays (with black hair). The Italian woman with blond hair who staffed the breakfast area on Saturday was wonderful. PROS: -convenient location -comfortable, if small (okay tiny), beds -internet access by computers provided in the lobby -friendly people at the front desk -good breakfast spread including a variety of breads, yogurt, cheeses, sliced cold cuts, cereals, orange juice, and fresh coffee / cappucino drinks -air conditioning -secure lobby and access to rooms by card key -balconies in some rooms that face the street -furnishings in good condition, including flat screen tvs mounted on the wall CONS: -hostile woman overseeing the breakfast area (really, I've never experienced someone who so clearly hated her job, all of the patrons, and never smiled once in 3 days) -they kept the same breakfast goods out until they were gone. For example, several of the pastries that were new when we started out on Tuesday were on their last helpings by the time we checked out on Saturday. We counted squares just to make sure we weren't misjudging this, and also you could tell because they got progressively staler. -tiny bathrooms (and I mean tiny compared to other Italian bathrooms which are already small to begin with) -lots of street noise -nothing special, its like staying at a Best Western - just basic

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, small hotel with fantastic location and staff”
Reviews.Author: gagirl7143
Reviews.Content: Booked Hotel Sonya and upon arrival we were told that we were moved 1/2 a block away to Hotel Opera Roma since we were staying 6 days and it was their newly remodeled site. After inspection, we gladly accepted the change. Hotel Opera Roma is a small boutique hotel and charming. It is located ideally for walking to all interest points in Rome.It has a bus stop is 1/2 block away, is a 5 min. walk to the train station, and has many good restaurants within easy walking distance. Rooms are very well appointed, clean and the bath was very large. Breakfast was ample and the dining room bright and welcoming.
