The staff is cheerful, very helpful and always willing to make your stay pleasant. Letu and the other staff were like old friends by the time we left. We are returning to Rome in Oct. and booked this hotel before we checked out. An added bonus was the notebook pc that was furnished free for the asking. The photos on line are representative of the hotel currently.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay due to very helpful staff, very clean, good location.”
Reviews.Author: linda50072
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very small but very comfortable, rather hidden location, nice bathroom with great shower and water pressure. The breakfast buffet was good. Location is convenient to metro. Staff was most helpful in giving directions, and also arranged transportation from the airport and to the port for our cruise. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: Stefeire
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for one night when we had to change our plans and fly into Rome because of the Volcano. It is a short cab ride, or moderate walk from Termini station, if you take the Metro line there is a stop actually 1 block from the hotel, which we found out later. The pics on here and Venere.com don't do it justice, its much nicer and in better condition. The breakfast was good, better than other places we stayed, with cereal, granola, yogurt, eggs, pastries, and cappuccino made to order. The room had plenty of space for the two of us, even had a little balcony onto the quite street (quiet for Rome that is). The location was great, as I said there is a Metro station close by, Trevi Fountain was an easy walk, and the Colosseum was maybe 10 min away on foot. All in all, a great place to have as home base. We wanted to stay there again when we decided to go back to Rome, but the weekend rates were out of our range. Will definitely try to book it when I go back to Rome, because I AM going back to Rome!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice surprise”
Reviews.Author: rjvanden
Reviews.Content: For our first three nights of our trip to Italy, we stayed at Hotel Opera Roma, and it was a great surprise. We've stayed in "small rooms" in NYC before so we had braced ourselves for a bed surrounded by walls...but it was a little roomier than we'd expected. The place was very clean, and the staff was very helpful, especially since our Italian is terrible. Props to Sylvia at the desk who was incredibly helpful and very nice. Even though we couldn't check in right away because we arrived early there was no issue while our luggage waited there for us. Great stay. Wireless network doesn't penetrate building very well, but it did work well in the lobby area. Location was great for us, not that far from the major downtown areas like Campo de Fiori and Piazza Novone (not sure I spelled that right). We are big walkers... and it only took 20 minutes or so to walk down there. And with the republicca metro station right around the corner the trip to the vatican was very short.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value, helpful staff and good location near Termini Station”
Reviews.Author: kitty206
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a nice stay at the Hotel Opera Roma. We were originally supposed to stay at its sister hotel Hotel Sonya, but they directed us here. We weren't sure what to think first, but Hotel Opera Roma was just 1/2 block down opposite (manager nicely walked us over), and it turned out to be a pleasant stay, overall. The general location is a little hard to find the first time--really pay attention to the directions on the website, and bring with you a detailed map. After a day or two, we didn't have any problems, but I wouldn't criticize anyone that decided to take a quick taxi ride (e.g. from the train station) to locate it the first time (Rome streets are so confusing!). The rooms are newer and more modernized. The staff was really nice and the manager went our of her way to help us print out museum tickets that we were having problems with. They honored coupons that we had printed from the Hotel Sonya website. We got two free tickets to one of the Hop-On, Hop-Off buses in Rome, which totally saved our feet the last day touring around Rome. We also paid in cash to get a discount. As Americans, this seemed odd, but apparently this wasn't out of the norm in Rome. They did take a credit card number when we checked-in, just in case. The hotel pricing was competitive with other hotels in the area, and for what we got, we think Hotel Opera Roma was a really good value. PLUSES: relatively large, modernized rooms and bathrooms; location is walking distance to Termini Train Station; free Wi-Fi and 2 computers downstairs in the lobby; mini laptop and memory card adapter available to borrow; satellite TV in multiple languages; friendly and helpful staff; available breakfast buffet, with fresh-squeezed juice and good coffee; has an elevator (but it's small and comes to a heart-jerking stop); very clean. MINUSES: location hard to find the first time, our room had a window but lighting was dim; bed was a little hard (but this seemed to be the norm around Europe); weird placement of fixtures in the bathroom, the toilet was only inches to the front of the sink.

Reviews.Title: “Inside the opera house”
Reviews.Author: CAOS_Traveller
Reviews.Content: The purpose of my trip to Rome was to go to the opera - Norma - in the Opera Theater. This hotel is right at the door, and it was very useful to be there to pick up the tickets one hour in advance and also to be ready on time, without stress. The hotel is not in the center of those busy streets, which turned out to be very good because it is very very silent at night, and just a few minutes from those popular neighborhoods. I also got a nice and new room, with everything that is needed. I recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel, close to rail station with key sights in walking distance”
Reviews.Author: WorldTravellerTony
Reviews.Content: Rome is very, very expensive so finding a value for money hotel is difficult. If you want somewhere that is clean, tidy, with helpful staff then this hotel is a good compromise. The room we had was pretty small with no outside window, but to be honest we weren't on our honeymoon, so spent most time sightseeing! Free sat TV, free notebook & breakfast not bad either.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, clean and near Roma termini”
Reviews.Author: Voyageuse15
Reviews.Content: The service was very good, very kind personal, Breakfast also good, The room was little but i think its normal in Roma 5min to the train station Roma termini, in the center. The entrance it a little bit difficult to find. I recommended this hotel to friend

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lena_Pel
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay here! Nice rooms, clean, good sized. Friendly and courteous staff. Free internet . Nice breakfast. Quiet street, short walk to Termini Station. Close to shopping and very well situated to see the sights of the historic centre.We highly recommend this hotel, if we are ever in Rome again we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel, Great Service, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: SusanRah
Reviews.Content: We had booked the sister hotel the Sonya. The Opera is just down the street. I believe the same staff serves both. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The Opera is newly renovated and lovely. Our room was beautiful-small but it functioned well and was well equipped with everything we could want. The breakfast room was lovely and they had a very nice breakfast. The location is great. We walked everywhere. There is free internet in the rooms and two computers in the reception areas guests can use. There is a lift. We were very pleased. We had awful weather in Rome. This was a great place to come home to each day.

Reviews.Title: “Good room, warm and helpful reception from the staff.”
Reviews.Author: travelpam18
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I really enjoyed our stay with Hotel Opera Roma. All the staff were so helpful and friendly. They were there to serve our every need. They arranged the transfers to and from the airport for a very reasonable cost and even opened the breakfast area early for us on two monrings to help us out. The location is very convenient to the train station and not too far to walk to the sites in ancient Rome. We enjoyed getting the exercise walking to most of the tourist attractions. The rooms are small, but clean and well cared for. My only complaints would be that the beds and pillows are pretty hard, and the outside street noise is considerable. We used earplugs, so we got a decent nights sleep. They have free internet in the lobby, but it is extremely slow and the keyboards need to be replaced. We would recommend this hotel to others who want to be near the train station. Great service goes a long way toward a relaxing and hassle-free stay.

Reviews.Title: “It was excellent leisure in Eternal City”
Reviews.Author: KeliautojasKedainiai
Reviews.Content: This hotel is cosy, quiet, clean, with very good location (almost all main sites to visit are situated about 1-1,5 km away), friendly staff, tasteful breakfast. Before trip we decided to choose hotel by reviews of the visitors. And we were 100 % right. I would like to recommend this hotel for every visitor of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “This was a great place to stay in Rome.”
Reviews.Author: Buster_Boy2010
Reviews.Content: I would definately stay here again. The room and bathroom were very clean and the bed was very comfortable. We stayed in a standard double room. It was a good sized room. Reza was very helpful and attended to our needs. The breakfast was more than enough to keep one going. It included boiled eggs, ham, cheese, pastires, breads, juice, and the cappucino was he best! The hotel has free internet access. It is also in a good location not very far from the Metro stop. There is also an elevator for those who aren't able to do steps after a long day of walking.

Reviews.Title: “Even the coffee ist smashing”
Reviews.Author: Brocante
Reviews.Content: It was a great idea to stay at the „Opera Roma“ when we came to Rome in February 2010. The staff was so helpful and kind, the breakfast was brilliant. We are looking forward to coming back as soon as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Top Hotel in Central Rome”
Reviews.Author: Maz-Daz
Reviews.Content: Great hotel (bed and breakfast) located centrally and in walking distance of all main attractions and Central Termini Underground Station. Staff extremely friendly and helpful. Room good size and very clean with all the amenities you would need. Room well decorated - mostly marble, very elegant. Also the room had air conditioning, so would be great for the summer. Excellent value for the money paid. We stayed 4 nights and it was worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “exellent”
Reviews.Author: plateia
Reviews.Content: very nice hotel.Exellent service,very good breakfast.The rooms are very clean.we rent the suite they have and it was in logic price.Was big enough clean ,with jaccusi.Everything was perfect.We recommet it.

Reviews.Title: “wonderfull hotel opera roma”
Reviews.Author: griggs1964
Reviews.Content: we were upgraided from hotel sonya. very pleased. we had a fantastic room with a jaccuzi, t and coffee facilities. the hotel is up a quiet street and near all amenities ie bus, trains and tourist attractions. the staff were friendly and helpfull. not a hot breakfast. only basic.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: Kathie99
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hotel Opera Roma for 4 nights with a couple of our freinds. We enjoyed our stay there: the otel is centrally located, we could visit all of the attractive places in old Rome by walking. the hotel and the rooms were very clean and newly renovated. The staff were very helpful and freindly. We got a free off charge access to internet and laptop. Its only minus was the size of the rooms; small.

Reviews.Title: “We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Hotel Opera Roma”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravel221
Reviews.Content: We highly recommend this hotel. It is easy to find and is within walking distance (with luggage) from the Termini train station. We did alot of walking, which is the best way to see Rome and this hotel is within walking distance to the Colosseum and the Trevi Fountain along with many other attractions. We were very fortunate to have our room upgraded to the multi-level room you see on the web site. It was lovely and we highly recommend this room. The breakfast included with the reservation is excellent, with lots of wonderful pastries along with fruit, yogurt, eggs and beverages. The hotel staff was very helpful in arranging our double decker bus tour of Rome as well as booking our transfer back to the airport. Prior to confirming our reservation with the hotel, we exchanged many emails and the staff answered all of our questions quickly and thoroughly. They were very helpful and friendly to deal with. We definitely recommend this hotel for your stay in Rome and we will stay at the Hotel Opera Roma when we return to Rome in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely great!”
Reviews.Author: Netochka
Reviews.Content: The hotel has very good location - it's not far from all of the main sightseeing places and it stands quiet at the same time! Staff is very friendly and helpful :) We really enjoyed the room which look more like small apartment!

Reviews.Title: “Small, nice and and clean hotel with a friendly staff made it pleasant”
Reviews.Author: zappa5
Reviews.Content: Our room was nice and clean with a small terrace, maybe a bit small (but not any big problem) and a little cold on the floor with the tiles. Good and quiet location in the historical Rome. Very friendly staff. We had a pleasant stay at the hotel and would say good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location, lovely staff and clean”
Reviews.Author: irishgirlrome
Reviews.Content: We were supposed to be staying in Hotel Sonya but when were arrived there we were sent to their sister hotel - Hotel Opera which was just across the road. Check in wasn't till 2 but we were there at about 1.30 and given our room. We were upgraded to a suite. There were 2 and a half floors in the suite, the bathroom was downstairs and was huge and included a Jacuzzi. There was a good choice of food at breakfast. The staff at reception were very nice and helpful. The hotel is very central it was only about 3 mins to a metro station. There were plenty of nice restaurants around the area also.

Reviews.Title: “Small Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NCLTFK
Reviews.Content: We booked on line after reading some good reviews. Convenient location, most friendly staff, well-appointed accommodation but poor breakfast which we did not mind since a couple of blocks away there's CASTRONI best place to start your day. Free wifi internet access higly appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place & staff”
Reviews.Author: zvigold
Reviews.Content: Liked my stay at the hotel. liked the room and hotel Cleanliness. the location is very good. breakfast need a bit more variety.

Reviews.Title: “A cozy, welcoming, and nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Solaris78
Reviews.Content: The staff of the hotel were extremely nice to us and we had a very comfortable stay in your hotel. Thank you very much and we´ll recomend to all people we know that are possibly going to Rome. Thank you very muchand our best regards to you!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: DublinTemple
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Opera Roma (new hotel). Location is excellent to most of the major sights. Room really clean and nice size. Bathroom really spacxious. Breakfast also very good and plenty to choose from. Staff very nice . Would definately return and would recommend to others. Had a really nice stay at the hotel and value for money was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, clean, modern rooms, good location - excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: NCNUK
Reviews.Content: Hotel Opera Roma is staffed by friendly, knowledgeable, and helpful people. The hotel has an historic feel, but is fully refurbished, comfortable and very clean. If wanting to stay in the vicinity of the train station and its relative proximity to sites in the city, this hotel cannot be beat for quality, comfort and value. My fiancée and I really enjoyed our stay. You will too.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed with Suite”
Reviews.Author: ChristineKathleen
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff recommended we book their suite b/c we were traveling on our honeymoon. It featured a nice jacuzzi and large room. It was almost twice the amount of the regular room but we splurged because it was our honeymoon. When we arrived at the hotel we were not greeted warmly, we were asked for our passports and shown our room. The jacuzzi did not work-it was empty b/c they were having problems. This was disappointing but we understood. The next day we were glad to see it filled but the water was cold. We inquired about the temperature and we were promised an answer in the morning but we never received one. This happened every night of our four night stay. We were finally told there was no way to make the water warmer, so we were unable to use the jacuzzi the entire time. We are still unsure about whether this reflects a difference in the way we expect a jacuzzi or if there was just something wrong with it. We expected a jacuzzi with hot water and jets, while the water was cold/room temperature with jets. At check out we brought up the issue again. We were given a slight discount after we uncomfortably pressed the issue. No one ever took responsibility for the jacuzzi issue and we constantly felt as if we were bothering them about it. Had we booked the original room we probably would have tons of positive things to say about this hotel because it was clean, the breakfast was nice, and the location was great. The evening staff was mostly nice, especially the woman. I might recommend this hotel for the regular room, but I would probably not stay there again. The main suite was not worth the extra money and the discount they gave us did not reflect the difference.

Reviews.Title: “A NICE AND SWEET PLACE TO STAY”
Reviews.Author: sprodanas
Reviews.Content: we've been at Opera Roma for Xmas holidays with my wife and another couple. It's a little very nice hotel to stay. the location ia very strategic, the staff is very friendly aand the rooms are very clean.I recommend it to everybody because you get much more than what you pay for......The breakfast room maybe is small for someone , but not for me.There is no lobby but there are many bars arround....

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Stay For Our Holiday In Rome”
Reviews.Author: Lancelyaite
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had definitely enjoyed our stay at this hotel. Although the room was a little small, it had the necessary amenities we need and was clean and comfortable. The staff were very professional and friendly. The location of the hotel was good as well with food, shopping and transportation facilities within walking distance. The coffee and cakes at breakfast were wonderful too.

Reviews.Title: “If we'll visit Rome once more we'll stay at the same hotel, for sure.”
Reviews.Author: KRISTIK76
Reviews.Content: The most important thing was the good location of the hotel: not far away from Termini station and historical center of Rome. The price for a double room in that location was very good. The services provided was above all our expectations (according to a 3 stars hotel classification): very clean and quiet room with fresh towels every morning, good breakfast, usefull and kind staff etc. Because our return flight was delayed one day and there was no double room available, we received an unforgettable offer for the suite room for the last night.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay.”
Reviews.Author: an_an2_2
Reviews.Content: I my stay in Rome was perfect as to describe it in one sentence. Season was perfect because it was not to hot and not to cold. And stay at Hotel Opera was perfect as well. There are many advantages of this hotel. Two most important for me was excellent localization and cleaness of the room and restaurant. Hotel is situated near the termini station from which everyone can get to every place in rome. It is also situated near many shops, cafeea and restaurants. About the cleaning every day we had new towels, soap and shampoo. Room was small however it was furnished in modern style and it had all the thing that we needed during our trip. Staff was perfect as well. Everyone spoke english and we had no problems to comunicate and get needed information. Breakfast was also one of this many advantages of hotel Opera. To sum up I honestly recomend Hotel Opera Roma for people in every age as it is the perfect place to rest after long day of sightseing The eternal city.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected stay in Roma”
Reviews.Author: SSGTJW
Reviews.Content: First, we were not booked this hotel while we were staying in Roma. Upon our arrival at Sonya Hotel, Roma, where the reception persuaded us to stay their group hotel (Hotel Opera Roma). Owing to our booking a triple room, I knew there was no room for triple in this hotel. This hotel only has Twin/Double rooms. An extra bed would be set up for three. We refused it. Afterward, we had an argument with the reception of Sonya Hotel. To avoid our unpleasant, we moved to this hotel with the assistance of Mr. Litu (staff of Hotel Opera Roma). To be honest, this hotel’s room is not suitable for triple. It is a little bit of tiny and we could not open our suitcase on the floor. On the next morning, Mr. Reza (staff) approached us when we were taking our breakfast. As he knew our unpleasant, he told us a bigger room would be arranged for change. After breakfast, he showed me a suite. To my surprise, it was a great offer which we unexpected. No additional charge would be added. After we did sights in town, our luggage has been already moved in the suite. The Opera Roma offers a high level of comfort and privacy. The imposing classical facade, the finely furnished, modern accommodation make for a truly elegant atmosphere. The suite boast a spacious Jacuzzi. The interior of the hotel is wonderful, the rooms were probably the best we stayed in whilst in Italy. Spacious, clean, very nicely decorated and comfortable. Start our mornings on a rich buffet breakfast comprising savory foods and homemade cakes and pastries, and indulge in free coffee or tea directly in our room. It's just a 10 minute walk from the train station and tube station which is really convenient for train/tube connections. Although the area is not the best as it's close to the train station, we felt quite safe. Staff were very welcoming and courteous, especially, Mr. LITU and REZA. I'd recommend staying here and would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “First Class-Modern and Clean”
Reviews.Author: Lance881Phoenix_AZ
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough good things about this hotel. It is a relatively short walk from the train station and one block from Via Nazionale with numerous restaurants and shopping opportunities. The staff could not be more friendly and helpful. The room was clean and cheerful with good lighting. It has obviously been recently been refurbished with new paint, new modern furniture, comfortable bed, a coffee/tea maker, free internet access, a lovely new and bright bathroom, a safe, a nice closet, etc, etc, etc. The breakfast was in a bright, cheery room, nice table cloths and dishes, a large selection of breakfast items and very good coffee and juice. Again the staff was so pleasant. All in all wish we could have stayed here longer, but our cruise ship awaits. Don't hesitate to book here for either a short or extended stay. You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Service Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 17always
Reviews.Content: The men at front are very nice and kind. Both Mr.Litu & Mr. Reza gave us a very very warm welcome & great service. The room is Beautiful but a little bit small. Anyway it's new & clean. Overall we're very happy, especially with the guys who we mention about. If we have next trip to visit Roma again, we'll choose this hotel. Thanks for your good service Mr.Litu & Mr. Reza. Hope to see both of you again. Please take care.

Reviews.Title: “Great place & they went out of there way to please you!”
Reviews.Author: TweedHeadsMonica
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Opera roma for 3 days in November 09. Staff we very pleasing and went out of there way to help. Room were nice. First room they gave us was small but very nice and then they offered us a larger room which was big. Breakfast was one of the best we've had in Italy, very nice and plentiful and coffee fantastic. Great price and would recommend this hotel to anyone. Monica

Reviews.Title: “I would visit the hotel next time again.”
Reviews.Author: Romy1109
Reviews.Content: A cute hotel near Rome Station Termini. Very quiet location. The service staff was very courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Very hospitable and friendly place”
Reviews.Author: TaylorFamWashington
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very well located and we felt safe to walk out at night. The breakfasts were excellent, especially the homemade cakes and lovely coffee. The internet facilities were also great. We would highly recommend this hotel to travelers. Thank you for making our stay great. We loved our stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: brightcrystal
Reviews.Content: Hy husband and I stayed at Hotel Opera Roma for 6 wonderful days. The staff was always helpful and, in fact, went above and beyond our expectations to meet our every need and request. The breakfast was good particularly the capuccino. The location was great - close proximity to all the great sights of Rome. Close to the Metro, which we used daily. We would highly recommend this hotel to our family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny Rooms”
Reviews.Author: SCRedOne
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Opera Roma for two nights prior to boarding a cruise. The location was very convenient. Staff was helpful and provided good directions and transportation info. Breakfast was very nice. Our TV never worked properly despite a valient try by the front desk personnel. My main complaint with this hotel was the size of our room. I paid approximately $250 US per night and got the smallest room I've ever had in a major European city. You could bearly get around the bed. There was no comfortable chair to sit on(mainly because one couldn't fit. The bathroom was so small that if you were sitting on the WC, you could easily hit your head on the sink. I believe the room # was 204.

Reviews.Title: “Your service is such that it distinguishes an excellent hotel from an average one”
Reviews.Author: reismutsje
Reviews.Content: My friends and I (6 in all) spent a long weekend in Rome. We were very pleasantly surprised by the location of the hotel Opera Roma but especially by the extremely good and personal service of the staff. All that made our trip very memorable. I forgot part of my luggage, which was sent on promptly, which impressed me even more. I will recommend hotel Opera Roma to anyone going to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Quality and Service all in one”
Reviews.Author: TravelBySelf
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a triple room for 1 night in October 2009. This hotel is just within 10-minute walk to the Termini Station in Rome, half a block to the shopping area at Via Nazionale. Location is great. The room has cometmporary furnitures, with two reading lights by the side of the bed. The closet is automatically lit up once you open the door. Water is hot and with good pressure. The bathroom is decorated with marbles. Breakfast is of good value, fresh made coffee, boiled brown eggs, pastries, cakes, yogurt, bread, juices and fresh fruits. The receptionist and staff all very ethusiastic to help. We arrived at 12:30 pm and they allowed us to check in early. Breakfast normally serves at 7:30 am. Since we need to leave early to catch the plane, they accomodated our special request to have breakfast ready half an hour earlier. We really appreciated it. Moreover, they have free internet access in the room. If you don't have a computer, they can provide you a lap top. All in all, I recommend anyone to stay at this hotel because of the convenience in location, service, quality and value. I will definitely go back and stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best places we stayed in Italy!”
Reviews.Author: dandy02
Reviews.Content: The staff was very helpful and very pleasant. We had a computer to use in our room free. The room was very quiet (no street noise) The beds were comfortable. The bathroom was exceptional. It was very large and had a whirlpool tub with a shower! The coffee served in the morning was some of the best we had while in Rome. The neighborhood had easy access to the train station as well as the subway. We walked everywhere while in Rome. When we traveled by train from Rome to Sorrento and back to Rome from Florence this made walking from the train station very easy. When I go back to Rome I will definitely stay here again. We stayed at the Hotel Sonya on the first leg of our trip, and at the Hotel Opera Roma on our way back. Even though I enjoyed them both, I prefer the Hotel Sonya, because it was a smaller hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel is in an Excellent Position for all the sights!!!”
Reviews.Author: Loo57
Reviews.Content: We were booked into Hotel Sonya but due to over bookings were given a room in the Hotel Opera Roma( Sister hotel). The hotel rooms were comfortable and very clean, but lacked information regarding the services available ie how to obtain internal phone lines, mini bar price list etc ( minor irritation).The staff were friendly and very helpful. The breakfast was excellent both in choice and quality.The hotel is in a perfect position for most of the famous sites especially the Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain. There are many places to eat locally which offer value for money. I would certainly stay here again and would reccomend to others.

Reviews.Title: “A great value hotel based on clean spacious rooms located near transportation and cultural sites.”
Reviews.Author: mftravels
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located approximately 5 city blocks from the train station so it was an easy walk. The hotel is on a side street next to the Opera House making it quiet and secure. We were pleased with the room. It was spacious with a full bath that was very clean and with all the amenities for a woman. The breakfast that came with the room was sparse, but adequate. The staff was courteous and helpful. In fact, they were able to give us our room on the first day prior to noon which was unexpected. The metro stop was only 2 blocks from the hotel which we used (1 euro each way) to get to and from the Vatican. We were able to walk to all the other cultural sites we visited. We would definitely return to this hotel on a return visit to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Was good for a budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: ChiTravelgirl42
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Opera for 3 nights in October. We primarily stayed there because of the price, and it was a decent hotel. Rooms were the smallest we encountered in our 2 weeks of Italy, but clean. The bathroom was also the smallest we encountered, but also clean. It was hard to manuever in the shower without hitting your elbow. The breakfast was ok (cheeses, meats, pastries, hard boiled eggs, made to order cappuchino). Internet was free, which was nice. The location was fine for us, but not ideal. About 6 blocks from the train station, and a 20 minute walk from most of the historic sites.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel the Keeps on Giving”
Reviews.Author: piratkween
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 9 nights at this wonderful intimate hotel. The rooms are sparkling clean and very comfortable. The breakfast room is lovely and the coffee is so good. We used the computer often and had so much help from the wonderful staff. Today, a month after our stay we are still using their help. We lost our camera, or it was stolen while we were in Sorrento, after leaving Rome. Today we had a phone call from Sorrento Policia saying they had located our camera. We could not understand most of the phone call but we gathered we were to send them an email with our mailing address. So thrilled! But we could not find the email contqct on the web. Finally out of desperation I wrote to Hotel Opera Roma and within an hour they wrote back to me with the email address! We will never stay anywhere else when in Rome, which is often. We also found the most delightful places to eat withing a 2 block walk of the hotel. I cannot say enough about the wonderful way we were treated. We feel like familia. Bill & Kathleen Mero

Reviews.Title: “All personnel were wonderful...friendly and helpful”
Reviews.Author: babsShushan
Reviews.Content: We spent four and a half months traveling in Europe for our honeymoon and found this hotel to be our favorite(we stayed in a total of 10). The main reason for this was the staff..in particular, the desk clerk, REZA, was very welcoming and helpful. He was willing to help us with reservations, directions, etc. and made us feel like we were valued guests. Breakfast room was also very nice with great breakfast and friendly staff. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Aahhh the beds!”
Reviews.Author: JW_Cleveland
Reviews.Content: Small hotel on a side street next to the drab opera hall. Nothing to look at from the outside but nicely redecorated inside. The room was clean, in good condition, quiet, and had a small balcony which we actually used. The mattresses were foam and super comfortable after long days of walking. Breakfast was very good, and the desk staff very helpful. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The front desk service was excellent, and helped make our trip great!”
Reviews.Author: laughinginlondon
Reviews.Content: This turned out to be quite a little gem of a hotel, minutes from Termini station, and not much farther to most of the major sites. We came here with a group getting ready to go on a cruise, and the front desk staff could not have been friendlier and more helpful to us - especially when it turned out a couple of us had lost our luggage. The staff not only repeatedly called for us to speak to the local baggage agents in Italian, they also called when we hadn't asked, just trying to get further updates for us each day when we had come back from touring (our bags eventually showed up on our third day, and the staff took them straight up to our room to keep them secure). The rooms were a little small - especially the singles, but the bathrooms were a good size, and ours even had whirlpool jets in the tub. Breakfast was fabulous - lattes, cappucinos, pastries, breads, meats, cereals, yoghurts, etc, and the gal running the breakfast room made sure we always had full coffee or orange juice. The front desk staff were also fabulous with passing on tourist information - we asked about tours, grocery stores, restaurants, train schedules, directions, etc., and with each request the guys went above and beyond to make sure we had what we needed - including a bottle of wine when we'd run out after the wine stores had closed. There is free internet access computers in the lobby, or you could take a hotel laptop to your room if you preferred, at no charge. We even had 2 sodas from our 'mini-bar', and it cost just 4 Euros total for both - that was less than buying one at the carts on the street!! Our room overlooked the front entrance and the side of the Opera House, and we didn't have any trouble with noise - and actually enjoyed the afternoon music rehearsal we could hear on one day. The hotel was charming, centrally located, and the service was absolutely 5 star!!!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel near centre and Termini station”
Reviews.Author: AdelbertJ
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our five day Rome stay in this nice, little hotel. Located next to the Opera and near Termini (metro) Station, all Rome attractions were easy to reach.

Reviews.Title: “Just Okay - Not a good location - stay somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: Bindikitty
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at Hotel Opera and have mixed reviews. We had reserved and paid in advance for a king size bed / room and on checking in were told it wasn't available until the next night - no explanation or apology. The room we were given was tiny and smelled so strongly of smoke that I barely slept. We moved to a bigger room the next day and it a bit better and cleaner. The location is terrible for sightseeing. It is close to the train station, but once you've arrived by train you don't need to be in that area - you're going to spend a lot of time walking to the sights and if you're squeamish about walking at night in a city, you're going to be very unhappy. We were glad to have a TV but the stations were really limited without switching to pay-per-view, which is mostly porn (as openly advertised in the bedside pamphlet) so we avoided it all together and were a bit grossed out. On the good side, the breakfast was delicious and the bigger rooms had nice places to spread out / unpack. The staff was very nice and gave us a free mini laptop and internet access so we could check on things at home via email. Overall, stay somewhere else - the Hotel Opera oversells itself. You only see pictures of the suite and the regular rooms are not much different than an American Holiday Inn, smoking is allowed in the rooms and the location is really out of the way.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, great rooms and great location!”
Reviews.Author: j_ho_holla
Reviews.Content: This was my friend and I's first time to Rome. When looking for hotels we were so overwhelmed as there are so many to choose from, and Rome is SOOOO vast that its nearly impossible to determine where it is to stay location wise. We chose Hotel Opera Roma (formerly Hotel Sonya) mainly for the price. Rome is incredibly expensive, and we decided to find a basic hotel that was clean and decent location, but try to keep it around $200 canadian a night. Hotel Opera was really the only one that fit our budget and from the pictures looked very clean, there were mixed reviews on location, but for the price, we booked it. When we arrived...the hotel went above and beyond our expecations. The hotel is AMAZING. The rooms are small...but who cares! They're modern looking, spotless, air conditioned, and very comfortable. The bathroom was spotless and the water pressure in the shower worked wonderful. Breakfast was included in the price. You walk into the breakfast room and the first thing you see is a friendly face asking you how you like your coffee. The lobby has two computers, and the hotel gives you free internet access which was such a blessing because we used it to email friends and family back home so we didn't have to use the phone. The staff is undoubtedly the nicest people in ALL of Rome. Honestly, italians are rude. People are mean, and they mostly do not provide service with a smile. But at Hotel Opera...its so refreshing because they are soooooooo nice! If it wasn't for this hotel and our wonderful stay there, my overall trip to Rome would be just mediocre (because like I mentioned before, Italians are quite rude even at restaurants and major sites. Our food experience in most of rome was mediocre, which was so disappointing and everything is expensive!). So thank you to the staff for making my trip to Rome a little more memorable. Before you arrive, make sure you email the hotel and ask for shuttle service from the airport. Its 15 euro one way for each person. You can take the train from the airport to the Termini and walk 10 minutes to the hotel OR from the termini take the metro to the 'Opera theater' stop and walk 3 minutes to the hotel from there for about 11 euro, but if you have lots of luggage...I don't recommend it. Arrange with your hotel a shuttle back to the airport while you're checking in so that you don't have to worry about a ride when you check out. Location wise...this hotel in my opinion is GREAT! It was perfectly situated. Its about a 20 minute walk to the spanish steps, trevi fountain and collseum...but if you don't want to walk, then DON'T. The metro is only like a 2minute walk away, and for 4 euro a day, you can ride all day to where ever you need to go, Vatican, Colleseum, Spanish steps, trevi fountain, Termini Station...it will take you there in minutes. Its so easy to use! We never used a taxi not once our entire stay there. There was absolutely no need. The only time we walked was when we were out after 1am (metro stops running), even then, we didn't find the walk that bad, especially because we the hotel provides a map, which honestly is the best map ever. We never got LOST because of that map. Our first time finding our way around was a little difficult because there are no street signs in Rome! The street names are on the side of buildings which can be hard to make out, but after figuring our way around the first time, you just start to remember the routes, so the next time you walk back, its easy. I liked that our hotel was central enough to be close to the major sites, but its nesteled on a tiny side street so that you're away from the hustle and bustle of the crazy Roman traffic. Me and my best friend are both female and we would be out walking about until 1-2am in the morning, and never felt unsafe. The neighborhood is not shady. That is why i think that is perfectly situated. I've seen hotels by the spanish steps and trevi fountain, and I'm glad that we did not decide to stay there because its way dirtier, shady and full of traffic and people, and the hotels look run down and old. I am very happy with where our hotel was situated. There are restuarants and pubs around the hotel if you want something to eat nearby, but I can't really recommend any of them because I didn't really like the food nor the service at any of the places we tried, so go around and experience yourself, you may have a better experience than me. If you want AMAZING italian food for great prices and friendly service, I highly reccomend taking a day trip into Florence, you won't be sorry. The best italian food of our whole Italy trip! So to sum up....STAY AT HOTEL OPERA! Even if it costs a little more, its worth it for the service and location!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in rome ,clean and modern rooms Good value for your money”
Reviews.Author: noamIL
Reviews.Content: stayed at Hotel Opera Roma for 3 nights and realy love it ,within 10-13 minutes from termini station and subway stops ,if you walk from termini station to the hotel the easiest way is to walk to Piazza Repubblica & walk down on Via Nazionale than make left on via Firenze (follow the Hotel Centro sign the building is next to the hotel) . on my arrivel I was given a room on the 5th floor which had a strong cigarette odor after complainnig that I can't stay there I switched to a room on the 1st floor (No 102) which had a bigger bathroom and save me useing the realy small and nerrow elevetor. the rooms are not that big but very clean and have all modern facilities from flat screen tv ,safe ,air condition unit ,mini bar ,hair dryer (with 120v-220v outlet) Free WIFI I even got a complementary asus eee laptop for my entire stay which was a big plus for me . the breakfast is very basic but good to start the mornning. the street of the hotel is very quiet and felt safe all the time however in some rooms you can hear any noise, the stuff is very freindly & speak english and given me a city map and marks all main attractions for me. this is not the chipest hotel if you are on a budget but it's worth every cent ,I will definitely see myself staying there again .

Reviews.Title: “CLEAN ROOM,COURTEOUS & HELPFUL STAFF, GREAT LOCATION, QUIET STREET.”
Reviews.Author: memorabiliak
Reviews.Content: Very enjoyable 3 night stay; staff very helpful in accomodating us. Close to most sights in Rome; easily accessible by walking. Train & subway stations very near also. Breakfast included in rate was very satisfactory. Bathrooms very nice(big clean shower area). Lots to like!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location and great service.”
Reviews.Author: MOfun42
Reviews.Content: We like everything about this accomodation and the service was excellent. Just remember when traveling in most European countries - there are no washcloths or bar soap. The rooms in the new part where we stayed were modern and very clean. They also provided a computer with internet service to use in the room at no additional cost. We were within easy walking distance to all the major sites in Rome. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good clean hotel, good location but difficult to find”
Reviews.Author: Vicky2405
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated approximately 10 minutes walk from Stazione Termini (where the bus from the airport terminates). This was my first visit to Rome and I found the hotel difficult to find from the directions given - the hotel is not 'exactly in front of the famous Opera House of Rome' as stated in the hotel literature. It is more like if you are standing looking at the entrance to the Opera House the hotel is located in th street running down the left hand side of the Opera House (look for Hotel Centro sign). However the hotel was in a good location with a selection of restaurants within walking distance and one of the many hop on hop off buses 'bus stop' is about a 5 minute walk from the hotel - it took us approximately 25 minutes to walk to the Colloseum. The hotel staff were very polite, friendly and helpful. The hotel room was very clean with good facilities - (whirlpool) bath/shower, TV, tea/coffee facilities, mini bar and small safe. Breakfast was a selection of cereal, bread, meat, egg, tea/coffee/juice and pastries. I threw my coin in the Trevi Fountain so will hopefully return to Rome one day and I would be more than happy to stay at the Hotel Opera Roma again.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: SergeOttawa
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very close to the main station (Termini) but a little far from some of the attactions. Other than that, it was perfect! Very modern, very friendly staff, super breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Value”
Reviews.Author: phoenix_fqtv
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel based upon the combination of reviews, location and price. The hotel met my high expectations. Room size is small by American standards but good by Italian standards. Bath is compact but modern. Air conditioning is outstanding and the room very quiet. Extremely helpful and cheerful staff. The free wi-fi (and a free laptop if you need one) is greatly appreciated. Breakfast is very good. I would definitely stay here again (actually I stayed twice, both at the beginning and end of my trip) and would definitly recommend it to a friend looking for this type of accomodation.,

Reviews.Title: “Great location - would definately recommend this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Mcnicki666
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a 5 minute walk from the subway, and is just off one of the main streets through Rome. Lots of good value restaurants close by. Within walking distance of lots of sights, and only a 20 minute walk to the Colloseum. Hotel was very clean and staff are very friendly and hellpful. We would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Choice in Italy”
Reviews.Author: Newed
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed here for our honeymoon. We toured 4 cities in Italy and Rome was our first stop. We stayed 6 nights at this hotel and it was the best place we stayed in Italy. Number one, the service was excellent. If we needed advice on where something was located, we received it accurately and with a friendly smile. Everyone who worked there always was very polite and gave us "service with a smile". Secondly, the location is great. It is within walking distance of Termini train station and the Republica metro stop. This was great for not only traveling in and out of Rome, but also to and from the attractions around Rome. Also, it has a great location along the main street where my husband and I found many restaurants and places to spend our evenings. Thirdly, the rooms were clean and comfortable and the location was safe. There was someone at the front desk all the time and monitored who came and went. Also, we went in August and it was so hot, but the air conditioning was a blessing. We would recommend this hotel in a heartbeat and will stay there again if/when we return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel stay while in Rome”
Reviews.Author: smokeyUsa
Reviews.Content: In my opinion, The Hotel Opera Roma provides everything a traveler needs while touring Rome. The location was perfect. The Metro and bus stop were 2 blocks away; the Stazione Termini, where you catch trains in and out of Rome, was maybe 3 or 4 blocks. The hotel and our room was spotless. The hospitality of the staff around the clock was wonderful. Always available and willing to assist with any needs. They also suggested itineraries and made themselves available to arrange any tour bookings, etc., we may have requested. Two computers with internet access are in the lobby area and made available for guests at your leasure. Great services is not always easy to come by these days and The Hotel Opera Roma was a refreshing place to spend some at while vacationing in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Rick Steve's was right, this place is great!!”
Reviews.Author: HappyRunner1
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Hotel Opera Roma on August 4th, 2009, having made reservations for 3 nights. How delighted we were. The immaculate room wasn’t large by US standards, but it wasn’t as small as we’d expected, having stayed in European hotels before. We had room for our 4 LARGE suitcases, with enough room to walk around them to the ample bathroom, w/all the necessities, including a hair dryer. There was plenty of storage, a small fridge, coffee and a small walk-out balcony that just big enough for us to sit out a couple on nights with a glass of vino and watch the world go by. The location was ideal; close to both the National Museum and the Termini Station. The hotel staff couldn’t have been more accommodating. From the offer of a free laptop for our room upon check-in to the cappuccino & hot assorted teas offered each morning with breakfast in the dining room. The breakfast well surpassed our expectations as well as there were delicious pastries, cereals, meats, yogurts, fruits, etc. We were given a friendly greeting each time we returned and were impressed. There were also two computers available for free use in the hotel lobby and we asked many, many questions that were always answered in great detail. We would definitely recommend Hotel Opera Roma to anyone looking for a clean, convenient and reasonable hotel room in Rome with very nice staff!

Reviews.Title: “Our best of Rome”
Reviews.Author: NativeCalif
Reviews.Content: After nearly a week in Rome (third time in Italy, first in Rome), I give the Il Cuore di Napoli on Via Cernaia a top recommendation for their excellent food and service. For the price (very reasonable), you can't go wrong with the food. We've eaten there twice and will go again tonight. We've tried several places and even more expensive was not better. While their wine wasn't worth drinking, it wasn't as bad as some places and our palates are used to good California wines. There are some decent wines here and if you want them, you'd better find them yourself in an enoteca or be willing to go to a significantly more expensive restaurant known for their wines. Eye Witness Italy reviews wines for each region and they look reasonable for not specializing in this area. Our hotel, Hotel Sonya and Hotel Opera Roma (their new section half a block away where we are staying) has been tops also. Everything was renovated in this new section and this has been the best bed I've ever had in many trips to Europe. Excellent air conditioning, cleanliness, service, everything you could want including free hotel-wide WiFi. Reasonable when you reserve some months in advance but almost 3 times the price at the last minute due to popularity, 315 euros for a double (not what we are paying!). I would come here again in a minute. Neither the Rome Eye Witness book or the Rick Steve's Rome book we had told us to reserve in advance for the Vatican Museums, but our hotel clerk suggested it (and offered to do it and the Borghese for us), and we found out the hard way that he was right. We've been fortunate in having no problems, although one guy was a bit too 'helpful' when we started to use a train ticket machine for purchase, but having had experience in Italy (Florence) in the past and reading up on all the possible scams in our guidebooks, we have been pretty careful and had no trouble at all. Best source for info on things like how to find out if there will be train or plane strikes while here -- see http://www.slowtrav.com/italy/planning/strikes.htm I've experienced 3 train strikes in 2 previous trips here and it was almost enough to make me not come again. That was before the Internet made info much easier to get. Big difference, along with becoming 'educated'. Come to Italy and enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: zambamamba
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very clean and they have every comfort. The staff is very friendly and helpful, and the breakfast is fantastic. I belive it is great value to your money. I would racommend it for shorter stays due to the room size. My finace and I thought thast it was the perfect getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel if you stay away from room 102”
Reviews.Author: Pippi2
Reviews.Content: Our review of this hotel is split in a negative and positive experience. When we checked in for our 3 nights stay, they gave us room 102. This is a room that is smaller than a shoe box. It is not possible to have your suitecase open and at the same time open the door to your room. This room is on the ground floor and have no windows and is next to the breakfast room. The breakfast room is noisy from approx 6:30 hrs and will clearly wake you up even if you are using earplugs (I did). Looking more closely at the reviews at tripadvisor I found a bad rating that was based on room 102. The next morning we made a polite complaint about the noise that woke us up and asked kindly if they could move us to another room. The resepsjonist behaved like he was waiting for our complaint and gave us a much better room on the 2nd floor. Our new room was nice and very quiet, and based on this room the overall rating is very good. We enjoyed the breakfast in the hotel. The location is also perfect as the distance to Termini train station is walkable even with a bit of luggage. The hotel is also very close to the Repubblica metro station. When it comes to the staff I must say that we are a bit disappointed that they gave us room 102 to begin with. For the room rates this hotel charges room 102 is not value for money. A week later we stayed in SuiteDreams currently rated as #1 of the hotels in Rome. This hotel is in the same neighbourhood as Hotel Opera. SuiteDreams was a much more pleasant experience than Hotel Opera.

Reviews.Title: “An ideal location, close to metro and a 12 min walk from rail station”
Reviews.Author: Sparkey58
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at Hotel Opera Rome very much, we preferred the second room that we were allocated upon our return - we had a split booking 2 days and 3 days. The second room had more space and a larger bathroom too. Nice breakfast, excellent coffee and very friendly staff. The only thing we noticed was the noise level in the breakfast room by the staff clearing away crockery. Other than this, it is an ideally located hotel and very good value for money. I was impressed by the internet service available and the loan of a notebook for our use in the room. I would recommend this hotel and would use it again when we next visit the very beautiful city of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, price & service”
Reviews.Author: lloydchirstmas
Reviews.Content: This hotel is centrally located with easy access to all of the marquee monuments as well as the train station. The service is effective and they are reasonably flexible when it comes to check-in times. Reza and his staff do a great job of accommodating their guests and are very helpful with tips for first time visitors. The breakfast is also delicious and is served for a relatively long period of time in the morning. Overall, a highly recommended hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location for exploring Rome”
Reviews.Author: MoonScotland
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideal located for exploring rome. The rooms were clean and of a good size, the bathroom was a little compact but had a large shower cubicle. The staff were very friendly and helpful and the hotel offers the little touches that make the difference - like free Wi-Fi and also the use of a laptop computer for your room. Would definitely use this hotel again if visiting Rome.

Reviews.Title: “We absolutely loved this hotel...”
Reviews.Author: VictoriaOrangeCounty
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Opera Roma six nights, August 11-16, during the heat (90 degree +) of summer. At the end of our busy days of sightseeing we were grateful to return to this cool, tranquil oasis. The quiet, efficient air conditioning was a life saver. Our room (Number 106) was spacious, clean, and comfortable with pleasing contemporary decor and elegant marble accents. Equipped with minibar, safe, complimentary wi-fi, kettle, hairdryer, excellent water pressure, fluffy towels, soaps, and comfortably firm beds and pillows, the room provided all the creature comforts one could hope for. We particularly enjoyed the beautiful breakfast room and made-to-order coffee. The continental breakfast buffet was always well stocked with a lovely variety of breads, cakes, cereal, yogurt, cheese, and meat. The hotel is conveniently located, just around the corner from the Repubblica Metro station and a short walk (five minutes) to the Termini where the two metro lines intersect. We absolutely loved this hotel and very much appreciated the helpful, friendly, and attentive staff.

Reviews.Title: “very friendly staff in a surprising nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: plantar
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated near via nationale 200 meters from metro and bus stations.The staff extremly friendly and helpful.The room clean and contains all the needed amenities.The street very quiet.Great A .C.All these for 99 eu per night,it`s an excelent value.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel in heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: Mariontem
Reviews.Content: After searching the internet for somewhere reasonable to stay in Rome that did not cost an arm and a leg I came across some reviews for Hotel Opera Roma, and have to say that it was great. Good service, nice rooms, good location and very helpful staff. I stayed for just one night but was impressed with everything from the first email contact, to the rooms which were just as described, to the breakfast, but the best thing was the service. A real find!

Reviews.Title: “Need a Hotel in Rome? Look No Further -- Superb Serivce-Driven Staff, Superb Facility, Superb Location!!”
Reviews.Author: BRGSmith
Reviews.Content: Considering a stay in Rome? Don't waste any more time. HOTEL OPERA ROMA IS THE PLACE TO STAY. My wife, daughter, and I stayed at the Hotel Opera Roma from 8-10 August 2009 (Room 106) during the last leg of our 2.5 week backpacking tour through Europe. Hotel Opera Roma is located on the very quiet Via Firenze at Number 11, just east of Via Nazionale, and two blocks from the Repubblica Metro station. It is within 15 mins walking of the Colleseum, Palatine Hill, Roman Forums, Pantheon, Trevi Fountain, and Spanish Steps. This newly renovated high-quality facility has a staff that is entirely dedicated to the best customer service possible. When we checked on on Saturday afternoon, the gentleman at the reception desk was professional, friendly and curteous, and took pains to show us to our room and explain the features -- keycard locks to the main hotel door, the hall door to the wing in which our room was located, lighting and A/C controls, etc. Two nights later, the gentleman was very helpful in assisting us with printing our boarding passes for the flight home. Breakfast is included with the room, and is served in a nook on the first floor, with customer-service focused waitstaff. There is a wonderful selection for breakfast, in the typically delicious and filling European style. Especially good were the large pie-like baked pastries cut into small sections, and the black coffee is without a doubt the best black coffee that I have ever had. The gentleman tending to drinks always brought a second cup automatically, and the woman that bussed the tables and set them up was equally friendly, courteous, and efficient, and did an equally efficient job cleaning the rooms. Our room was SPOTLESS and completely sqared away and picture-perfect each day. Hotel Opera Roma is a wonderful value and worth every Euro cent; we were still talking about how much we enjoyed our stay there and the Hotel's exceptional service-driven staff while driving home from the airport last night. B R Smith

Reviews.Title: “Great service, great location, great choice!”
Reviews.Author: UkTravelCan
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my sister in Hotel Opera in May 09, the location is great, and worth paying the extra, most sites are within walking distance, and also close to the metro. The service was friendly and courteous, and I have recommended this hotel to family and friends. Mr Samra

Reviews.Title: “A very beautiful place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: alfred54
Reviews.Content: a small hotel, close to all attractions, at metro station Repubblica. Clean room, clean suite-room with whirlpool for a very reasonable price. The staff is very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Opera Roma is the only place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: maleika24
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 5 nights at the Hotel Opera Roma in July. We had a fabulous stay!! The room was spacious (#209) and the air conditioning was fabulous as we were there during a bit of a heat wave. Try to avoid room #211 it's a bit small. Breakfast is delicious as is the made to order coffee. All in all one of the best hotel stays of our travels. Reza does a great job of answering questions and making you feel at home. We would stay at Opera Roma on any future travels to Rome!!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Opera Roma: a Cool Oasis in Rome's Historical Center”
Reviews.Author: librarymedia21st
Reviews.Content: Gracious hospitality greeted my husband and me at the Hotel Opera Roma in July 2009. Our room, with the cool marble floors, air conditioning, double bed, desk, and free internet service was all we were expecting and more! I plan to stay at the Hotel Opera Roma on a return trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: blueprl22
Reviews.Content: We were originally booked at the Hotel Sonya, but they said it was full and we were going to stay at the Hotel Opera. What a nice hotel. We had a huge room (by European standards) and the bathroom was huge too. The room was always immaculate and the a/c worked well. There was always someone at the front desk no matter how late we came in. Breakfast was nice and convenient. The neighborhood felt very safe. There is a grocery store down the street and its a great area for shopping, but the restaurants werent very good and were very touristy. Be sure to go to the opera. I"m not a huge fan but it was a lot of fun!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: MyriamBrisbane
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the Hotel Opera in June /July 2009. We hadn't been to Italy for many years and found Hotel Opera to be a very pleasant surprise. The room was recently (and quite lavishly) refurbished and quite spacious (even with an additional bed for our 14 year old son). The bathroom was huge. There was free wireless internet access from the room, The hotel seems to be a smaller off shoot from a nearby hotel and so there aren't a lot of staff. But those that there are, were friendly and very helpful. The manager Reza seemed to be everywhere and very willing to help. When my wife enquired about a coffee shop when we first arrived after a long flight - Reza was back with a cappuccino almost immediately. Breakfast was basic but more than adequate. The hotel is centrally located near to the main railway station - but off a quiet street. And the cost was very reasonable compared with other places we stayed in Italy. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “I'd recommend it”
Reviews.Author: ciaraneoneill
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel in July 2009. It was located convenient to shops, bars and all the main tourist attractions. The rooms were bright and airy and the staff polite, and helpful. The facilities were modern and the rooms kept clean and tidy. The cost was reasonable. I'd certainly consider staying there again. Some of the shops around the hotel offer very good value for money in terms of food and drink - worth bearing in mind if you are travelling on a budget. I dont speak Italian so I'm not sure what all I've ticked in terms of boxes here!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - Great price, location, rooms etc....”
Reviews.Author: 2710jade
Reviews.Content: I booked this direct with the hotel, it was the best price around (425 Euros) for 4 nights in July, which was excellent value for the centre of Rome. Great location - near metro (2 mins), buses etc if you want them. All major sites within walking distance (10/15 min Trevi Fountain, Colosseum etc). Rooms - Good size with TV, Laptop, Kettle, Fridge, Safe, A/C etc. Bathroom - Large shower which was powerful and plenty of hot water. Great mirror with a smaller one for makeup with a good hairdryer. Breakfast - Typical continental - bread rolls, ham, salami, cheese spread, jams etc. Cakes, fruit, yoghurt. Tea, coffee, orange juice etc. Staff - Reception staff were excellent, really helpful, pleasant and polite with everything you asked. Always gave us great directions to places, good restaurant recommendations.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Diplos
Reviews.Content: This is small hotel (sister hotel of Hotel Sonya nearby) but the rooms were clean and the air conditioning was excellent. Via Firenze is not a busy street, so the hotel is quiet at night - besides the double-glazed windows would keep it quiet even if on a busy street. The location, near the train station, makes it ideal for trains and buses. The hotel has free internet and you can request a laptop (netbook) for the room too which I thought was a nice touch. Easy to walk to Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, Piazza Navona, etc. We walked everywhere in Rome. Hotel has a small elevator. Rooms have flat screen TV and SKY. Staff were very friendly and helpful and I would definitely recommend this hotel to friends and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “clean and friendly”
Reviews.Author: anousckaB
Reviews.Content: The hotel and rooms were very clean. The staff was very helpfull and friendly. The room was not a triple room, what we ordered, but a double with a third bed, so very small. The breakfastroom was to small for all the guests, so you had to wait. But, I would go back! There was no streetnoise ans the location was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel for the Price”
Reviews.Author: Live4Travel_Now
Reviews.Content: I pre-paid my room about 45 days before I left and felt like I got a great deal. The room was updated and the perfect size for my teenage daughter and myself. The shower was also nice, not too small, and was cleaned every day. The only thing was that the room was a little on the dark side, very small window for sunlight. But that was very minute and we loved the hotel. We would return again!

Reviews.Title: “Better then we expected”
Reviews.Author: Marek_Poz
Reviews.Content: Very well located, comfortable hotel with very friendly service. The room was big, the bathroom to. For English tourists - yes, they have an electric kettle in the room, tea and coffee included. Strongly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Best experience of Rome”
Reviews.Author: angelescua
Reviews.Content: The hotel has one of the best locations: close to the Termini station and all the major attraction points in Rome and lots of small restaurants and pubs with good food at affordable prices. The staff were amazingly friendly and helpful. Rooms are clean and spacious enough and when I checked in I was handed in a notebook for free wireless Internet (which was very helpful). Breakfast is very good and one can make his/her own tea/coffee in the room with no extra charge. Overall, a very pleasant experience, recommended to anyone traveling to the beautiful Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful and Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: riteshdesai
Reviews.Content: Top Notch service by all the hosts at the reception. Litu was the best. The rooms very larger than any that we had seen in Europe and very modern and trendy. The breakfast was good too. We had problems with the laptop that they provided as it was in Italian and i screwed up by trying and losing all my songs on the Ipod (but I got them all as soon as I came back home to Seattle). It was nothing in compared to the comfortable 3 night stay at the hotel. I would go back there again and would recommend it to anyone with a family.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel in a great city”
Reviews.Author: Sopp
Reviews.Content: stopped at opera roma in june (22nd for 4 nights). booked direct via website - fast return on e-mail, they also arranged taxi pick up from airport. flowers and wine in room on arrival, offered own computer in room etc - nothing was too much trouble. they had a problem on the first night so we stopped in a small double rather than the larger double we had booked. however they offered a full suite if we wanted it for the last two nights. they advised on sites, how to get there, good restaurants etc. breakfast was typical continental fayre - again pleasantly and efficiently served. rooms were well cleaned, good air conditioning etc. would go back without a doubt - not only is it great but well located for station and within easy walking distance of all the city centre sites. they also lent umbrellas to guests!

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected find”
Reviews.Author: sydneygray
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel a very pleasant place to stay. We stayed for 5 nights and each time we entered the hotel there was always a smiling face to greet us. The selection at breakfast was fulfilling. There was no traffic noise in the room we were in. The staff were very helpful and friendly and advised us on possible sightseeing locations when asked. The only downside was the bathroom and lift were a bit small. But overall we had a excellent stay and would return again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and helpful service in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: lugequeen
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Opera Roma was a comfortable gem right in the center of Rome. The staff are incredibly helpful and friendly and the rooms are comfortable and impeccably clean. It is located in the heart of the city close to bus stops, the subway and just a few blocks from the train station. I would highly recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great small hotel with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: psc27
Reviews.Content: Service: The service is excellent (both at the front desk and breakfast area). Rooms: although a bit small and quite dark, they are newly renovated and impecable. The bathroom was also very clean and brand new. Complimentary breakfast: all the basics as well as just baked cakes included. Very good overall. Internet access: Internet speed is okay, but the best of all is that we got for free a laptop to use during all of our stay. Never seen this service offered in any other hotel. Location: walking distance from main attractions (20 mins) and very convenient if taking the metro (5 minute walk) or train from termini station (5 minute walk as well). Easy access to all Rome attractions. In general excellent price/ value.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: mdingenouts
Reviews.Content: This was e great hotel with a very good service as well. The people who work there where very very polied. Good breakfast, simple but very good. Nearby a lot of restaurants and bars. Central in Rome to walk to your sites. All together. Good!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel for the Price”
Reviews.Author: bbellinger
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Hotel Opera for four nights in April 2009 and loved our stay. We were looking for a hotel that was safe, clean, close to everything, and within our budget, and this hotel covered all those areas. First, the staff was incredibly friendly and helpful. The location was perfect- just off Via Nazionale where you can catch a bus, 5 minutes to Piazza della Repubblica and the subway, and 10 minutes to Termini. The room was very clean and comfortable and everything in it was fairly new. The breakfast was outstanding, tasted as good as it looks in the pictures on their website. And the laptop computer they lend you for your entire stay was extremely beneficial in keeping contact with our families at home and researching things to do. We hope to get back to Rome again some day and would have no reservation staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, accommodating, convenient, modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelerCarol
Reviews.Content: Going with Rick Steves' recommendation, always right on, we found this hotel to be exactly as expected - new, modern, helpful staff, excellent breakfast, internet access in room, all the conveniences with the most pleasant of rooms. Definitely recommend this place and would stay there again when in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Their service can't be beat!”
Reviews.Author: travelswithdiane
Reviews.Content: I took a single room, about 6’ x 8’ with a private bathroom. I needed an inexpensive place to stay for one night before catching my flight home and I had trouble finding something in my price range. I’ve had closet-sized rooms before and I knew about this when I made the reservation, so there were no surprises. They did the best they could with that tiny space (they even had a make-up mirror in the bathroom), and offered to loan me a computer with free internet access for the evening in my room--how special is that! The air conditioning in my room worked extremely well. I mention this because some hotels mention air conditioning on their websites, but will not have it available except June-August, and I was here in April. I found the service at this hotel to be excellent. Tripadvisor should look into this hotel carefully for next year's awards for service. I was impressed. I didn't see any other rooms, but the corridors looked freshly painted. This was the only hotel that provided a magnetic room key that I was able to keep with me. The bed was comfortable and the linen was fine. My only complaint would be the lack of a soundproof window. Should I return to Rome I would stay here again and ask for a quiet location. I reserved here to be near Termini, but I saw a sign they had at the counter about car service. The night before my flight they arranged a private car for me to go to the airport. A gentleman neatly dressed in a suit arrived in a rather plush Mercedes. This was a great deal at 40 euros, and much better than trekking to Termini for the Leonardo Express. A great way to end a great vacation. If you need a break from the Italian cuisine, I found a Chinese restaurant very close to the hotel, Wang Xiang Lou. It's between the Opera House and Termini. Not fancy, but filled with locals, and the food is good.

Reviews.Title: “SERVICE WAS EXCELLENT”
Reviews.Author: ScotlandSjs
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful time at this hotel, its one of the quietest rooms I been in in a major city no outside noise. The staff were fantastic the girl who cleaned our room deserved a medal as it was alwas very untidy. We were round the corner from the tour bus which did a tour of all the major sites in Rome. This was a birthday celebration and the hotel were great in letting us use the breakfast room to have a celebration before we went out for dinner. We used taxis a lot from the hotel but found them to be inexpensive as there were 4 sharing. Good location, easy to find,good value for money, great breakfast, fantastic staff

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic little hotel”
Reviews.Author: valj58
Reviews.Content: We were a group of 11 ladies celebrating a 40th and two 50th birthdays. Had originally booked Hotel Sonia but were moved to Hotel Opera. I cannot comment on how good the Sonia would have been but we certainly don't think we lost out with the Opera. It was everything we could have wanted. The service was second to none. Breakfast is simple continental style but an excellent range and fresh. You are served immediately on arrival with fresh orange juice and the best cappuccino. The breakfast room is pretty compact and bijoux so you may have to wait a few minutes for a table. There is no bar in the hotel for us not aproblem as we were there to see Rome and not the inside of our hotel. Excellent location only 5-10 minutes walk from Trevi fountain and many other historical sites round about. The staff assisted us in decorating the breakfast room for a small birthday celebration with banners and ballons etc before we went out for a birthday dinner. They were very enthusiatic about our celebrations and could not do enough to help. The rooms are very clean with a mini bar, good showers and the most comfortable hotel bed I have slept in in years. Special thanks to Michael and Rigos for all their help. I would not choose to stay anywhere else if in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place at perfect price. Within walking distance to everything!”
Reviews.Author: Quicker
Reviews.Content: What a great stay! Hotel is super friendly. The service was top notch. Rooms are small, but have everything you need...fridge, waters, TV, wifi, clean bathrooms (very important in Italy as some bathrooms leave much to be desired). If you are looking for a room with tons of space and expect to spend leisure time in the room, then this may not be great for you, BUT if you are looking for a clean room, authentically friendly service in an area within walking distance to everything (Borghese gardens, Coliseum, Trevi area) then this is the place. Oh, and did I mention the staff and the great service? LOCATION: You will need a taxi or bus to the Vatican, but everything else is within walking distance. There are many good shops and coffee bars around the block, and the hotel is situated right off of Nazionale which is a main strip for shops, food, etc. Literally, it was a 5 min walk to the Coliseum located to the south. 5 min to the Trevi area with tons of gift shops and some great little wine bars and restaurants, but be sure to wander off the beaten path as that is where we found some of the best places where the locals gather. Train station is only about 5 blocks. Don't bother with a taxi because the taxis are more hassle than it is worth. If you don't have too much luggage, then just break out a map and walk the 5 min walk.
