AMENITIES: During our travels, we spent very little time in the hotel, however we wanted a good hotel, clean, good price, friendly service, great breakfast and this was the place. If you want 5 star service (room service, spa, restaurant, etc) then you will have to spend substantially more, but these services seem redundant when you consider that great any Italian trattoria or cafe is only a block away. Ask the people at the front desk about good coffee shops, wine bars and trattorias. They will give you recommendations for good local spots that you would otherwise never find and trust me, you will enjoy. This is so much more authentic than sitting at the hotel bar, right? NOISE: We stayed on the front side of the hotel, and the rooms were fairly quiet. I have seen other reviews with complaints of noise, and if you are a very light sleeper, then you should expect problems at pretty much any hotel in Rome because let's face it. Rome is a bustling city and is noisy, but during night hours at Opera Roma, I felt that the noise level was more than reasonable. Some cars can be heard on the street, but for the most part, the street was quiet, and the noise did not penetrate the rooms. ROOMS: The rooms are small, but most European accommodations are not spacious unless you are willing to pay the extra price. All in all, the rooms were perfect for my husband and I. The bed was large, there was a closet and safe. The bathrooms were very clean. Rooms had a TV, wifi and closets. The shower was very small (no bathtub in my room) but it was clean and functional. Water pressure was awesome! If you want a spacious room, then buyer beware because you will pay the additional price. We stayed at two hotels in Rome and the second we paid more and did have more room, but the cleanliness and service was lacking. I would definitely choose Opera Roma over the other. Probably not great for kids but I didn't see the larger rooms, and there were couples there with children of various ages, so obviously it is feasible. BOOKING & PAYMENT: I recommend using the hotel website directly for booking or calling. They all speak perfect English and various other languages. Knowing Italian always helps when getting around Roma, however Opera Roma accommodated Asian, German and French travelers while I was there as well. Ask to pay cash for a discount. You will save about 10 or 20 euro per night. LOCATION & AVAILABILITY: The sign out front is small, but if you find Via Firenze, then you cant miss it because the street is only about 2 blocks long and is situated on the left side of the Opera house. The owners also have Hotel Sonya a block away. Opera Roma only has a few rooms, so if Opera Roma is full, ask about Sonya as the staff and ownership are wonderful and Sonya has recently been renovated.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Bruno1971
Reviews.Content: I had a fantastic experience in this Hotel in Rome I was in the suite..........free wi-fi - clean hotel - people very nice and helpfull - good breakfast but the suite is incredible...fantastic my wife did not want to leave Rome because of that!!!!

Reviews.Title: “comfortable, reliable hotel”
Reviews.Author: anonymousBRU
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a quiet street. There is a bank nearby. The hotel unfortunately has no bar. Staff is friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't do more”
Reviews.Author: t00n3r
Reviews.Content: We arrived shattered from organising my mothers funeral and were quite dissapointed to learn that we were to be transferred from Hotel Sonya to hotel Opera. We were fully assisted the short walk and then given a map of the city with a comprehensive suggested tour. We were given a small laptop with free internet access, superb to keep up with the preceeding weeks events. The room was clean comfortable with memory foam matress and a well presented bathroom, sadly no bath but high pressure shower. Breakfast was plentiful with superb Capuccino. Staff could not do enough to help. We were so pleased to have been moved but still don't know what Hotel Sonya had to offer, perhaps we will try it anothet time.

Reviews.Title: “Trip to Rome”
Reviews.Author: TYPE14
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, friendly staff,would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: speedylaur
Reviews.Content: I loved staying at Opera Roma Hotel. Great services, great staff and very nice rooms everything included !

Reviews.Title: “Good location, overall comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Traveladdictportugal
Reviews.Content: The hotel is near the centre of the city, the rooms have recently been remodelled and look very modern and above all very clean! The breakfast is well served, the staff is friendly and the hotel suits the purposes of a cultural get-away to the eternal city. It is near the main underground lines and there are bus-stops, restaurants, cafés and shops within a 200m walking distance. We used the underground much less than we expected.

Reviews.Title: “Above and Beyond all Expectations”
Reviews.Author: Orikio
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at Hotel Opera Rome for 7 nights in December, while visiting and enjoying the beauty and charm of Rome for the first time. The hotel staff and amenities were absolutely incredible, and we would highly recommend this hotel for travelers on a budget, since it's simply a hidden jam in Rome, which gives you much more than you'll expect for the price you pay. It all started with a very good communication via emails and Skype, with a very fast booking conformation, without and advanced deposits or credit card charge, and with full cooperation with our requests (such as early check-in or luggage safe keeping since our flight arrived at Rome early in the morning). The Hotel is within very convenient 5-6 min. walk from Termini, and even with heavy luggage on a rainy day, it wasn't that bad... We checked-in at around 11:00 AM and received our lovely room (no. 207) immediately. The rooms are very modern and squeaky clean. Everything was working properly and the house keeping staff did a marvelous job every day. The windows and wall are all sound proof and very isolating, and you can hardly notice the weather outside even when it's stormy. The bathroom features a full sized tub with a Jacuzzi, which was a real delight every night, after a very long day of walking and sight seeing all over Rome. Breakfast was a treat as well, with the hotel's wonderful staff that comes to know all your 'breakfast habits' and tries to accommodate your every wish, with a smile. Breakfast included everything that is featured in the hotel's web site. With home made cakes and great Italian coffee. Also, in case you are wondering, I can verify that all the pictures in the hotel's web site represent the exact reality that you'll encounter upon arriving to the hotel. The rooms, the entrance, the lobby and the breakfast hall, are just as pictured. But above and beyond the facilities and the breakfast, I have to commend the wonderful staff! In all the shifts and during our entire 8 day stay at the 'Opera', we always encountered the most helpful, kind and polite staff, which went above and beyond in order to help us out. Just for example: in one of the mornings, we had an early train to catch to Napoli, which was booked and paid for in advance. Our money for that day was locked in the safe (the private one, in the room), and from some reason, it just wouldn't open. At 6:30 AM, the reception staff, tried to help us open the safe, with no luck, and with the departure time for our train getting closer and closer. After a few minutes, my girlfriend (Which on that Rome trip, also became my fiancée), asked him whether we could get some cash and deal with the safe when we return. Without any doubts and immediately, we got the amount that we requested (200 euro) in cash, and not once until our check-out, 5 days later, we were asked to settle the bill. There are more examples like that one, but I guess you got the idea. To summarize, Rome is unbelievably charming and romantic, and for us, Hotel Opera Roma, was a great experience which helped our vacation to be more that we could dreamed of. We will definitely go back. After sending our families to enjoy as well! Thank you Reza and all the wonderful staff. Ori Rivash and Sarit Helmreich Haifa, ISRAEL

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Opera Roma is irreproachable.”
Reviews.Author: lulom
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have been very pleased by our stay in Hotel Opera Roma. It is very quiet and close to practically all the main touristic sites of Roma. The room was clean, modern and very functional. Breakfasts were simple but abundant and assorted (may be an Italian cheese would be included in the buffet). The free Internet connection is very valued and useful. Finally we were delighted by the personal response; they were available and they did their best to solve any kind of incidence to at any moment. Congratulations!

Reviews.Title: “location , service, value”
Reviews.Author: WicklowKiwi
Reviews.Content: Just back from 3 nights at this hotel having met friends with a 1 yr old. It exceeded our expectations for under 100euro in the centre of Rome within 5 mins walk from termini station. The hotel was quiet, very clean, centrally located to attractions and had good restaurants within a few mins walk. We found all the staff very helpful , informative and friendly. Every request was met willingly and there was a very good breakfast. All in all it was a very positive experience that made us feel like it was a home away from home and it had excellent pillows to boot which is a rare find in europe. Well done Litu, Reza and staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Find In Rome!!”
Reviews.Author: RPPMP
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in a few hotels in Rome, this one is the best by far. We loved our stay, this hotel is very modern with large comfy double bed, flatscreen TV, sky TV, in room safe, balcony (overlooking via firenza looking up towards via nazionale). The bathroom is awesome with double shower. Location is great within walking distance to everything, we walked to Trevi, Spanish steps etc. If you want to go to the Vatican or Travestere (Travestere is good for dinner reasonable prices) very easy catch the bus on Via Nazionale. The reception staff are very helpfull they will tell you what bus to catch and any information you require. Free internet was a bonus. Breakfast is Italian style. When you check out reception will hold your luggage so you can continue your sight seeing, if you have an afternoon departure. We booked direct with the hotel, communcation was very good and prompt. Close to Termini a 10 minute walk. We highly recommend this hotel, if we are ever in Rome again we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Everything we expected”
Reviews.Author: PiperMpumalanga
Reviews.Content: We needed a hotel that was close to the station and yet central to the city sights. It was an easy walk from the station to the hotel. We walked from the hotel to the Trevi Fountain area for an evening meal. The hotel was everything that we hoped it would be. Clean, well equipped room, excellent internet access, friendly service, delightful breakfast room with a delicious spread. The hotel stored our luggage for the day while we went sight seeing as we left Rome on an evening flight. Thank you Hotel Opera Roma for a very pleasant stay. Reviewer: John and Margo, South Africa

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel”
Reviews.Author: CiaoClaudia
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay here! Nice rooms, clean, good sized. Friendly and courteous staff. Free internet (even offered us a free mini-computer to use in our room). Nice breakfast. Quiet street, short walk to Termini Station. Close to shopping and very well situated to see the sights of the historic centre. Offered a shuttle for 14 euros/per person, a deal when the direct train to Fiumicino is 11 euros/per person. Would definately go back.
